Reviews.Title: “Queens Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located near HydePark with helpful people and good service but walls were Very thin! Rooms are adequate but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: Suburban_gay
Reviews.Content: There were holes in the walls and bathroom door. The towel rack fell off the wall. I put a do not disturb sign on my door but the house keeping staff walked in anyway. The buffet breakfast was disgusting. Tinned tomatoes heated up, the coffee is like hot bitter dishwater. I ended up eating breakfast out most mornings. I asked for a 4am wake up call, luckily I woke up at 4.15am by chance. I never received the wake up call. I checked out and listened to the staff argue over how many nights I had stayed and If i had paid my account in full... I had prepaid weeks before I arrived. On that subject, I had to email and email and call 4 times to finally get the hotel to process the payment and issue me with a receipt. They eventually processed the payment. I then had to follow them up again for a receipt. Absolutely appalling customer service. The corridors are like a rats maze and the carpet is worn and Old. The lifts are scary and ridiculously small. To top all this off after 3 nights I developed what appeared to be a rash. By the end of my stay I went to my doctor who said the red spots on my arms and legs are bed bug bites. My advice to anyone looking for affordable accommodation is to save up a bit more cash and splurge on a hotel with another few stars. this hotel is advertised as 3 stars, it would barely make 2 stars. Worst hotel experience EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: TheMrsC1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 5th floor.Corridors were like rat runs & the room was smelly.It smelt of drains.Heating was cranked up to full and it was quite a warm day.Breakfast was like a free for all.They ran out of plates and had to ask at least 3 times for them.The lifts were very scary!!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: chowmein1uk
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad price for a one night stay at this hotel. Rooms aren't too bad quite clean and tidy. Beds can be a little on the uncomfy side. Breakfast is average. I would advise to not stay here if your in London for more than a couple of day.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone makes out”
Reviews.Author: katie s
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in December 2011. I had read the reviews on here & some are comically bad so I was a tad apprehensive about what we were letting ourselves in for. However, we are of the opinion that all you will do is sleep & shower in the hotel so if these bits are ok then thats good enough for us. We were pleasantly surprised. The room although small was big enough for both him & me to move about & spread our belongings about. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was absolutely fine. I cannot honestly find one thing to complain about & really can't see what other peoples problems are. The breakfast room did get full quite quickly but we soon worked out the best time to go to avoid everyone else. The best thing I think though was the lift, it is beyond tiny. My hubby is a big guy, but I'm small & we just about mananged to squeeze ourselves in laughing all the way up. All in all we have a great stay not one thing wrong with the place. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A night in London? Yes, please, without roaches.”
Reviews.Author: F3l3y3
Reviews.Content: I love London. I really love London. This was my first time to reach my dream come true. I got the opportunity to go for short holidays in my ..well, my life, since I have professor's degree in English language and literature (second language). So, visiting London it's life changing experience. But, little I have known that this trip would be (almost) spoiled by this hotel I have already booked and paid. First of all, BELIEVE bad reviews. They do help. I did so, since I could not have money refund (it was the deal of day, but I did not look and this was MY mistake and my own fault). Old enough to admit a mistake when I make one. So, I stuck with this hotel in October, the day I booked it and they charged immediately. I know this was my mistake. But, luckily I am an old traveler who knows basic rules, that go as well in Hitchhiker's guide trough galaxy: ALWAYS TAKE YOUR OWN SHEETS AND YOUR OWN TOWEL! This literally saved my life. The room they gave me was not the room I have booked, it was triple basement room, which had so much dust on telephone that the room itself looked like never used before, the evidence of past use: the paper from candy left under the bed. Dead roach under the bed for third person (luckily again, I was alone) who has been there for God knows how long)...do these people have maids?? I've asked myself. But the next morning I discovered they do, since I found new towel in bathroom (I used my own towel as pillow sheet, and my own sheet as something clean to lay on. That morning I woke with tremendous stomach cramps. I thought it was just English tea, and my gastric problems. But the next morning I woke at 4.30 and to discover that when I get up, I do not feel any cramps, but if I try to lay down, my stomach is killing me. It was then that I realized the thing was about their sheet (I still used mine, but I put them on top, I didn't remove theirs), I smelled them and it was awful! As if someone died. I thought about Four rooms by Tarantino. So, I didn't sleep at all during my stay in London, thanks to this hotel that gave me this kind of room. And that horrible smell. I am really tolerant and I can take a lot. But, to call yourself a hotel with three stars and charge as much, it's really too much! I still like London, I didn't let that Hotel ruins my happiness for being in London, luckily I booked for two night only, it was not that cold, so I did not have to use covers (the bed was so grouse that I didn't even want to go in, but rather put my sheets on and sleep without any covers). As I am tolerant, I haven't said anything, and it was two night only. I am pacifist. BUT, in any OTHER CASE, I would rise war! If this hotel has good rooms, I haven't seen any. I will definitely go back to London and stay at the same neighborhood, but this hotel I will avoid in big circle. Positive: Location, nothing else. And Consigliere, very polite and helpful. The lady who was working at reception: very unpleasant and unfriendly. Negative: Rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: suska3453
Reviews.Content: internet cost 2 pounds/hour. It should be free. I first had a room that was renovated and quite nice. I was very happy about it until 6am when i realized that it was next to kitchen and the staff was so loud I could not sleep. I assumed all the rooms are the same quality so wanted to change, but they gave me a room with dirty carpet, tv had just 5 channels. ( the other room had at-least 26), the room temperature was +30c and someone smoked hash above or below so all the smoke had come in while the window was open. I was then given another room in the basement. That was very moist and and has mould on the wall. I could not open the window to get fresh air. I would not pay more than 50 pounds for a single room. the staff was ok, but sometimes they were not around and people were looking for them. Bed was not good.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: kellyg73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Easy enough to get around. I booked a triple room and it would be like the the picture, but it seems we were put into a double with an extra bed squeezed in. The bathroom was nice, but the rest of the room was cramped. There was a horrible draft and this basement room smelled of sewage. The breakfast was ok, but the hotel was so booked that it was difficult to find a space to sit. I did get a peek at some other rooms that looked much nicer. I would not stay here again, but if you do, make sure not to get a basement room.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: glyn1981
Reviews.Content: we were dreading going having read some of the negative reviews on this site. However on arrival found the staff very friendly and accommodating. we went to our room and I promptly inspected the bed. The Linen was clean and so were the rooms.you could make a list of minor petty faults like there was a gap under the door it needed a lick of paint and the rooms were quite small. For the price we paid we couldnt grumble at all.lets face it you only stay in your room to sleep and shower. It was a a base with a clean bathroom and a clean bed.Nice hot shower also. Breakfast was buffet style nothing fantastic but cereals toast fruit yoghurt rolls hot drinks fruit juice scrambled eggs tomatoes beans mushrooms and sausages as well as croissants cheese preserves, enough to fill up on till lunch. Value for money not a four or five star place.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.......”
Reviews.Author: Perculators
Reviews.Content: Bit dubious after reading reviews, however, my view was we were only staying for 1 night for a theatre break. We arrived in London early and found the hotel. Reception welcoming and helpful. Asked if we could use the luggage room for our bags, the helpful receptionist checked our booking and said our room was available. We found the room went in and the room was not ready, the bed was unmade etc, I did think Uh -oh....... Went back to reception where they apologised and organised another room staright away. Room was as stated by other reviewers, small and compact but spotlessly clean & as you don't spend much time in your room anyway I don't see this as a problem. Location is fab. Breakfast was fine, had better but had a lot worse. Shower was a slight issue, I had a lovely shower, however my partner had no hot water, and limited water supply. Rang reception and they sent up a key for another room to enable him to shower, not ideal but the matter was dealt with quickly and efficently. Summing up: Good hotel, clean, friendly, efficient and in a great location. Ideal for a sightseeing break and I wouldn't hesitate in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “rude, and poor value for money!”
Reviews.Author: nat92x
Reviews.Content: when we arrived we waited 10 mins to speak to someone in reception to check in. The rooms are very small and the bathroom even smaller. The shower only worked when it wanted to. We had scaffolding outside our window so no outside light was coming in. I stayed here with my family. The breakfast was disgusting and only one member of staff available who was rude and not willing to help. No mugs or glasses to get a drink. Or forks. and beware of the lady cleaning the tables with the trolley. She's dangerous rude and face like a bulldog chewing a wasp. lifts were very small and dangerous. Door were hanging on one hinge in corridor. Hotel was full of foreigners who were rude! Never again!! Don't let this hotel spoil London because outside of the hotel was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: essexbird26
Reviews.Content: 13 of us stayed here on a hen weekend, all our rooms were clean and tidy, which after reading some reviews on here i was suprised at, staff were friendly, and the young man on reception was very helpful, there are some good places to eat just around the corner and the pub at the end of the road is good for a visit,

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Value!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past. It was ok then but certainly nothing speicial. First time back for nearly a year or so. The hotel has gone through some significant changes since my last visit. The communal areas have gone though a significant upgrade. The lobby and breakfast area is now vastly improved and the rooms seem to have been upgraded as well. Whilst my double room was compact the bathroom was surprisingly larger than expected and the room had coffee/tea making facilities, a flat screen tv and newish furnishings. Hotel also offers wi-fi in your room (at a nominal cost). Staff are very pleasant particularly the lady receptionist who greeted me. Full breakfast buffet is also included within the price which was very popular with the guests. All in all a very pleasant surprise. Will most definitely look to stay at this hotel again. Finally there seem to be some fantastic deals to stay here at the moment. Look at the various hotel search engines. I am sure the price will start to go up as the year progresses. I certainly would have expected to have paid a lot more for the services that were on offer so I am certainly not complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing amazing, but nothing awful either”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: This was a good, albeit average hotel. I don't mean that to be demeaning, I just mean that as a hotel it is very much an average West end hotel in the budget bracket. It does not have a bar or room service, the rooms are basic but comfortable, the environment clean and warm but not luxurious. My room (503) on the top floor was very warm despite the windows being open because when I visited (January 2012) they appeared to be building an extension to the rear of the building and so the whole rear of the hotel was encased in tarpaulin. I adjusted pretty quickly, but warmth is better than the alternative in January in London, so no real grounds for complaint. The bathroom whilst compact was actually larger than many bathrooms I've seen in hotels in this price bracket. The bedding was clean, the room was clean, and the general standard of accommodation was good for a budget hotel in this neighbourhood. People complaining about the size of the lift, the quality of the breakfast, the size of the rooms, etc. simply just don't have any experience of West London hotels: this is a good, average, budget hotel. It won't win any awards, but there are far, far worse hotels within a stone's throw and they'll charge you twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “HOSTEL!”
Reviews.Author: JENNA T
Reviews.Content: this is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in!! if you want a hostel then stay here! the rooms are very small and stink! the bathrooms are awful, it was that bad i couldnt bring my self to have a shower.. when you arrive the reception looks ok so we were releaved - until we went to the room! the corridors were tiny and dirty with marks all over the walls, when your asleep you hear everything!! we heard everything in the room next door, in the mornings you heard every up and running along the corridoors. the only nice thing i can say is the breaksfast was nice. i would never stay here again - and for Â£90 per night it was a complete rip off !! the receptionist was VERY rude aswell !

Reviews.Title: “A good all round stay”
Reviews.Author: isagteam
Reviews.Content: I dont quite understand all the negative reviews re this hotel. I stayed here at the beginning and end of a trip to the UK along with my American friends (end Dec & beg Jan). I found the reception helpful and cheery, the rooms, small but comfortable and clean, the breakfast was wonderful and the surrounding area of Bayswater is ideal for a myriad of restaurants and easy tube access. There was some construction noise, I agree, and the lift is very small, but for the price, the food and the excellent location, I was very happy with the hotel and would not hesitate to go back. I am assuming that the negative comments are posted by rival hotels!!? - If you found this hotel bad, I suggest you check out some of the travelodges in London - now thats what I call bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: kmrkjr
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend break in London over the festive season (Dec 2011) and stayed in this conveniently situated hotel (short walk to bus / underground links). Staff were friendly, helpful and accomodating. English breakfast included in the reasonable rate. Rooms were clean and comfortable, tho the toilet was positioned very close to the bath and rather awkward to use! Other than that would definitely recommend this hotel for a short London stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quirkeyangel”
Reviews.Author: Quirkeyangel
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveller having stayed at various hotels in London, I first stayed June/11. Have now made Queens Park my London Hotel. had 3stays totalling 10night. Good Value for money. All Public transport easy to access. Surrounding area, very well lit, a must when on own & returning by Bus(94) from Theatre/Piccadilly. Breakfast is very good, plenty of choices. Staff professional &approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Winno1967
Reviews.Content: The rooms have not been maintained, there is paint coming of the walls. The bedroom 411 where we stayed had broken curtains and window latch, creaking floor boards, toilet and shower drains blocked, the room smelt stale and of cigarette smoke. Breakfast was continental with cooked consisting of sausages, beans, scrambled egg, tomatoes and mushrooms. Ok if you like this but it never changed. Be aware of ordering a taxi from here as they have there own people doing it and charge more. This is not a safe hotel, we even had our belongings gone through and checked out. Overal a very sad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “For that price - very good”
Reviews.Author: elig
Reviews.Content: If you expect to pay 2* prices and get 4* value, you'd be disappointed. On the other hand, having paid 60 pounds for a clean room, very comfortable bed, renovated bathroom and reasonable breakfast - warrants a 4 star review in my opinion. However the reviews which referred to room and bathroom size are right: they were indeed small - and when sitting on the loo one's knees bumped into the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cysgodfaboss
Reviews.Content: After reading some uncomplimentary reviews I was not expecting a lot!! the room was snug, but there were three of us sharing, luckily we were close family. Saying that the room was clean and warm, we were on the ground floor, and if you were not 6 foot tall quite impossible to open the window's which were set up quite high, so it was a stand on the bed job. The bathroom was modern, but if the extractor fan was not on the room could be quite smelly. The biggest plus point was the good breakfast, a really nice addition, as I have in the past paid Â£15 for what we had at the Queens Park. Excellent transport links to central london, also for the mesuems and Albert Hall. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again for a short stay in London, we purchased Oyster cards fot travel, which were invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for central London”
Reviews.Author: funfrog
Reviews.Content: I must have stayed in about 10 different hotels in London at the cheaper end of the market, and I can only think of one better - and it has now put its prices up. The one thing that can be guaranteed about these hotels is that the rooms will be small. Very small. Tiny. The Queens Park is trying its best to improve itself. The reception area is lovely, the breakfast area is pleasant, and the rooms have obviously been recently decorated. The scaffolding at the front may be inconvenient for some but clearly to paint the facade it has to be there. I booked three rooms for ourselves, our friends and our son and we had a great stay. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The bathrooms were en-suite - great! The breakfast was by no means gourmet but it was quite acceptable and left us satisfied and looking forward to the day. Lets face it, no-one goes to London to spend hours sat in a hotel. The staff were fine. The lifts were tiny - but they were there, and were a giggle really! We've had to drag suitcases up three flights of steep, narrow stairs before now. The location couldn't be better with easy access to just about anywhere. So my advice would be to stay at the Queens Park, don't expect pallacial rooms but get out and enjoy that great city!

Reviews.Title: “I suppose you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nannaPaignton
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewers we felt the lifts small ,room was also small.The bed was against the wall making it difficult to get out of.The bathroom was also tiny .Water dribbled out of shower and luke warm and we had to request a sink plug.Breakfast was not bad but as things ran out were not replaced until a guest requested.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: sophie w
Reviews.Content: On arraving at the hotel first impression very good, nice clean reception. They asked for Â£20 out of my account which i was fine with. Went to get the lift which was so small that me and my girlfriend could barely fit in with our suitcase and it took forever to come down. Trying to find our room was a nightmare with the carpet on route looking really old and worn. Got to our room and was not impressed was very small for a double with light swiches hanging off the wall bed sheet disgusting and looking warn. My girlfriend after waking up had bits all over her. Going into the bathrrom was small tiny shower, dust on the toliet sheet and basen. Was disgusting it STANK was awuful didnt even want to go in there. we were staying only 2 nights but after gettig back we were expecting our room to be cleaned which was not done for them to just walk in at 5 o'clock. Found it amazing that there was no information pack to give you numbers to call reception or anything. TV so small could barely see it. Breakfast was inedable corrisants werent cooked, egg runny no bacon. im very dissapointed at the amount i paid for the hotel i would definatly mot stay here again and would not reccomend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ftamk
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with one of the smallest elevators I have ever seen. The bathroom smelled so bad it woke us up in the middle of the night. The cleaning lady folded wet towels, which led to damp and cold towels to dry us the day after. For breakfast they served toast with jam or cheese, traditional english breakfast directly from cans. Nothing but the scrambled eggs were home made or fresh. The building site just outside our window was active from 7 am friday, saturday and sunday. The fact that sheets and showers were clean prevent me from rate the hotel Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!!”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: We had the extreme misfortune to use this "hotel" for one night, in a 'double room, which was so small we had to swap places in order to move within the room! The bathroom was MINUTE, more like a cubicle.Breakfast was a free-for-all, with insufficient seating and limited choice of VERY mediocre food.When checking out at 09:00 we asked if we could leave our luggage, and were informed it would cost Â£1 per item to use the 'left luggage room'.When we said we would return our cases to our room until check-out time of 12:00 we were told that was fine????. This appears to be some sort of 'scam' on behalf of the staff...PLEASE PLEASE AVOID this apology for a hotel AT ALL COSTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: HannahJ88
Reviews.Content: Booked a deal through superbreaks with rail and 3 nights in queens park hotel, I must admit I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews but had a lovely stay! First of all it is in an excellent location, Hyde park across the road and 2 tube stations less than 5 mins walk away, which was perfect for getting about and doing all the sightseeing! When we first arrived the staff were really friendly and were very helpful throughout our stay. We were in room 319 which is in the recently refurbished part of the hotel, the room was brilliant! I had read that the rooms were small but there was plenty of space with a decent size double bed and even a little kitchenette :) the bathroom had a good shower, was always warm and plenty of water pressure! We had breakfast only once as we ate out most mornings, the breakfast was ok, simple buffet with hot items (but we didn't pay for it so didn't mind not eating there every morning) So basically I would recommend this hotel for location and also great value (we paid Â£165 each for rail travel and 3 nights stay) thoroughly enjoyed the trip to London and was made even more enjoyable by a comfortable stay :D

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: haunteddoncaster
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on here, I was starting to regret not checking this site before booking. However, when we arrived at the hotel, we were pleasantly surprised at the modern clean reception and friendly staff. Yes, the lift is tiny, but that's hardly the end of the world! Our room was in the basement, and upon hearing that, my heart sank. But, the room was lovely. Clean bedding and a large brand new bathroom that had 2 showers!! Wouldn't mind having that bathroom at home actually. Breakfast was lovely too. The only thing that I meant to mention to reception was the tv only picked up 2 channels (I forgot to tell them), but let's face it, when you're in London, the last thing you want to do is watch tv! Would definitely visit again

Reviews.Title: “For travelers its fine.”
Reviews.Author: CinarK
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel february 2011. I just sign up last month and i should write my old experience about this hotel. I think this hotel's location is good. In thirty second you can arrive hyde park by walking and location is so close the underground station (queensway) central line. So this mean you can reach too many places with this line. Also in my opinion price is cheap. We stayed 7 nights in double room including breakfast 335 pound. That's so reasonable to stay in central location in london. Moreover, hotel rooms are too small but i think it should not be a big problem for young travelers. My advice; if your expectation is not too high and you will visit some places whole time in your day. This hotel satisfy your need.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Mummy26wav
Reviews.Content: I was worred about staying at this hotel after reading some negative reviews but i didnt find any problems with the hotel. My children and i stayed for 2 nights recently and had a brilliant time - staff where helpful - the breakfast was great and our room was clean and a reasonable size considering its London that you are staying. The location for the 2 tube stations was great and having Hyde Park on your doorstep was a bonus. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and exceptionally good value”
Reviews.Author: juststartin
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean and comfortable, well located Hotel, at a great value for money price for central London, then this is the place for you. The accommodation is "no frills" but had everything that we needed for a site seeing trip. The buffet breakfast was good if a little busy (shows how popular the place is with tourists who all get up at the same time of the morning!). Reception service was quick (despite being busy) professional and helpful. They looked after our cases after checkout whilst we did more site seeing (Â£1 a case we thought was quite reasonable). Also in a lively area of London, but surprisingly quiet at night. Very handy for 2 tube stations and the parks for lovely walks too. We really have no complaints about this hotel. Ignore some of the frankly nasty and I think totally unjustified, comments lodged. Remember this is not 5 star accommodation but then you would not expect that for the excellent room rate for a budget hotel. Our only comments are minor niggles which were not really a concern to us but may matter to some people: The lifts are very small and cramped if you suffer from claustrophobia. It is a long trek up narrow stairs to the upper floors if you are not fit and able! The breakfast area though light, airy and quite spacious, is not able to cope with all of the guests wanting breakfast at the same time! If you don't want to queue or fight for your toast, coffee and cooked breakfast etc, then I suggest you get up early! The rooms though comfortable are not overly spacious, though the 3 of us were fine, it was rather cosy!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SRFC186605
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 29th of September 2011 for 1 night. Hotel in central location 5 mins walk to Queensway tube station. Room clean, brand new bathroom. Presantly surprised having read recent reviews. Hotel clean, staff helpful, breakfast very good. Very busy hotel. Our room on ground floor slept like a log. Would have no hesitation in returning. Two of us stayed one night, brilliliant price, breakfast included. SRFC Fan

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: firefly1310
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Queens Park hotel for 2 nights. We was two women, our room was number 118, clean, comfortable, the staff was kind, the berakfast was good. This hotel is very near to 2 metro stations - Queensway and Bayswater and many restaurants and shops around. We canÂ´t say anything bad about this hotel and when I shall go to London again, sure I come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Review of no view”
Reviews.Author: 551weeble
Reviews.Content: what can we say. we had a room that you literally could not swing a cat in. we were not told about the building work being done to the hotel, we had scaffolding outside our window for the 4 days we were there, and yes you have guessed it we couldnt see a thing because of the huge polythene screen that was put up by the builders. we felt totally claustrophobic. we were woken up every morning at 7.30 with hammering drilling etc.we work hard for our holiday break and are disgusted that we had to put up with that. oh and before we forget if your expecting a good breakfast then go out for one.

Reviews.Title: “Location good, service poor.”
Reviews.Author: Dolcoath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Queens Park Hotel for 1 night, while passing through London. Its location was very good, being only a couple of minutes walk from Kensington Park, 15mins walk from Paddington Railway Station and fantastic for access to London in general. However on checking in, the hotel had no details of our booking although this was found after approx 15 minutes. The problem seemed to be dealt with in an inefficient manner with it being handed from one member of staff to another, with no one seeming to take the lead. No apology was received for this error from any member of the staff, including the management. The lift to our room seemed to take ages to arrive. In fact it was at our floor but the door had failed to open. A passing cleaner noticed us and the problem, and banged the door with his hand opening it. Needless to say we had no confidence in the lifts after this. Furthermore if you are claustrophobic don't take them! Although the sign said it could take 4, it was a struggle for for the two of us to fit in with two medium cases. Our room was very small but I suppose it was adequate in size for one night's stay. The bed was uncomfortable and the walls were thin between the rooms. Consequently we didn't get a good night's sleep. The small shower room, although very small, was clean. Breakfast was poor. The croissants appeared to be uncooked. The tables were cleared in front of us, with the food waste being emptied straight into an open slops bucket. Not very appealing or professional in my opinion. The highlight of our stay was the ability to leave our luggage at the hotel after we had checked out, until the end of the day for only Â£1 per case. The concierge was the best member of staff by a very long way, being friendly and efficient. He seemed pleased to do a good job. We wont be using the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hotels that charge you before you stay”
Reviews.Author: jesoid
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a family group for one night as we were going to the proms in the park, location suited us, unfortunately we read the reviews after booking. A little concerned about the hotel taking payment from our card before we had arrived.Whenever we have stayed in hotels before we have always paid on departure,obviously this doesn't bode well if you try to get a refund,which I am guessing happens often enough for them to take payment first. Still I thought give it the benefit of the doubt. We arrived to check in around 3pm to find one of our three rooms wasn't ready (resolved after half an hour).In the twin room my mother found one of the beds had a soaking wet mattress, this must have been noticed when the bed was made as there were some towels under it in an attempt to dry it out. The occupants were moved into another room only to find out when we returned from the concert that this room had no electrics...you would think after the first room they would have made sure this one would be fit for purpose.So after all that they were moved into room number 3 at 1.30am. Our room was small but clean,one of the lights didn't work and the shaver point in the bathroom (I use this term loosely) wasn't working either. I have a feeling the hotel raided an old POW camp for the bedding, the blanket we were provided with was itchy and so not much sleep was to be had. If you suffer from claustrophobia then for gods sake give the lifts a very wide berth, someone has jokingly put a sign in them saying 4 persons..if you try this then I would advise you know the people you share with as you will be getting very intimate with them. Breakfast was ok apart from the fact they didn't have enough knives! When we asked for some more we were told they were all out? As with others who have commented when we asked to see a manager about a refund for my mothers trouble we were told no-one is here please call back tomorrow

Reviews.Title: “position good, breakfast ok”
Reviews.Author: dihoppo
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights, there are two lifts in the hotel of which one was out of order and they only hold 2 people at at time, together with this the stairs where out of bounds due to hotel extending into next door. the rooms are over five floors and so you can imagine everyone trying to go up and down to breakfast two at a time!in a very slow lift!!! we decided to try the stairs as is was getting very hot to be met with the stairway boarded up so we went out onto the fire escape to the ground floor and over building area and back into breakfast room, Our room was one of the 'new' rooms the toilet seat came off in my husbands hands, there was no remote to the telly, one thin pillow each and 1 sheet 1 blanket but no bed cover no extra if cold . we will not be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, unfriendly service”
Reviews.Author: Kj_1409
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. Positive's- breakfast and location is very good. Negative's - Wifi not free, unfriendly and cold staff. staff do not care about guests. since our room was on the side where construction work had just begin. so our window was totally blocked.

Reviews.Title: “We will never be back !”
Reviews.Author: alifiyan
Reviews.Content: Date :9th July 2011 We booked this hotel for just one night based on its availability and location in Central London. Even though this Hotel is Centraly located - it has to have possibly the worst rooms we have ever stayed in. The room had space for only one person to move around - though we has asked for a family room for 4. This was supposed to be the big size. It had space for only one small suitcase, a tiny window close to the ceiling (which had no value). However, it did have a TV wall mounted. The toilet was okay. From a cleanliness point of view, it would just about pass the mark. The elevator was so small - that we had to go down 4 times to get the luggage all up and the corridor to the room would be a protential fire hazard. It would be hard for a person and luggage to move through that. The only thing that was nice about the Hotel - was the breakfast and the staff. The breakfast was a full English breakfast and the staff were friendly and helpful specially with the kids. If you have any other alternative Hotel to stay in, in Central London, please do not book here. It is just not worth it. It had also had no WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “a good value”
Reviews.Author: pfdk
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, small rooms, small breakfast room, small lift. This is not Hilton but a good value for your money. Everything is small including the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced,uncaring staff,very small room,very noisy guests !”
Reviews.Author: tjharbott
Reviews.Content: Breakfast and location a plus but that's about it! Wifi was out for 5 days and the staff really didn't seem to care!noisy guests,interrupted sleep,management need to be more aware of late check in or guests returning late!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly service, and hotel is on the way down”
Reviews.Author: travelerforfrs
Reviews.Content: When we came in, there were other customers complaining at the reception. We soon would learn why. Although we arrived nearly at 3pm, our rooms were not ready yet, and the receptionist declined to make a firm statement when they would be. They were also impolite to rude. In the rooms, the light in the bathroom was broken. As was the trashbin. The toiletseat was swollen up with some mold on the underside. The bed was clean and the room was small but acceptable. When trying to call the reception one evening, first they did not take up the phone, then they actually picked up the reciever just to put it down again, instead of answering. I would never visit that hotel again. With friendly staff, this would have been an OK stay, but this way, you felt unwelcome and spending your money for keeping the wrong people in employ. The breakfast was simple but sufficient, baked beans, sausages, egg, toast, jam, butter, and yoghurt and croissants. Nice sliced oranges, too. The street was quite loud outside, with renovations going on next door.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: DFagan1980
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Our bathroom flooded when the guests in the room above us had a shower which meant we couldn't use our bathroom. This was also a fire hazard as the electrics was in the panel in the ceiling. The staff couldn't move us apparantly as there were no more rooms available (I find this hard to believe!). The staff are very unprofessional and do not care about their guests. They wouldn't give us a refund and said there was no manager available at the weekend. The breakfast room is also a shambles. I have seen more order in a school canteen!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a London hotel - why is everybody complaining?”
Reviews.Author: milly80
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for the tube and transport, and for Hyde Park (we were there for a concert). We paid Â£85 for the room including breakfast, which is very good value for London especially given that concerts were taking place and it was a busy weekend in the city. We stayed in the newly refurbished wing of the hotel and our room was very modern - wooden floor, smallish flat screen TV, double bed, desk, hairdryer, tea & coffee making facilities, and a sparkling new shower room. The bed was quite comfortable and we didn't hear any noise even though we were there the weekend of Hard Rock Calling and the hotel was very busy. These types of hotels in Bayswater are much of a muchness - Victorian style houses that offer B&B at good value (compared with other London hotel prices). If you want a plush hotel stay somewhere that costs you Â£150 odd (if you're lucky!). To put this in perspective this was cheaper than Travelodge for the night we stayed. Speaking of breakfast this was quite nice and included OJ, tea/coffee, hot food (sausages, scrambled eggs, tomatoes and mushrooms), toast, croissants etc. all buffet style. I would describe these hotels as being not hostel-like (have the people who have written these reviews actually stayed in a hostel?) but more like a B&B than a hotel. I would definitely stay here again if visiting London and couldn't find a bargain hotel... It was clean, pleasant and well-located, and breakfast included in the rate was a bonus. We were also able to leave our bags there after we had checked out, as they have secure storage for Â£1 per bag.

Reviews.Title: “Try Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Andrew5061
Reviews.Content: The smallest double room ever, so small the bedside tables were just wide enough for a cup! The bed was the creakiest bed in the world.No remote for the TV, reception found one for me but the batteried were flat. so had to manually operate it....only problem was that it is so high on the wall I had to stand on the bed to perform this. Tea/Coffee not replenished daily. Placed the plug in the sink and couldnt get it out, Electronic card key stopped working. Fire escapes blocked with dirty laundry The rooms and corridors are so small that it gets stuffy with no air circulating. Breakfast....go either early or late as it gets very busy and more like a canteen with poor quality produce. No bar facilities. On a plus...its location to Hyde park and the tube are to be commended

Reviews.Title: “loved it will be back”
Reviews.Author: pammy7-10
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the queenspark hotel whilst visiting the tennis in Wimbledon. stayed in room 319 it was brand new, immacuatly clean and modern. breakfast was a choice of continental or cooked, breakfast is complimentary. staff very helpful, would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here -1* its terrible smallest double bed in the world”
Reviews.Author: Alison150376
Reviews.Content: Rubbish disgusting can't even get duvets, one pillow, cold shower

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BogeyKent
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice and each time we have found the staff friendly and very helpful. Booked a twin room each time but were given a room with three beds. Bathroom small but adequate. Plenty of hot water. Buffet breakfast was ok but not really enough seating area. Location is excellent. Two tube stations close by. Plenty of shops and restaurants. Will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok to spend a night”
Reviews.Author: JungleCatUkraine
Reviews.Content: good location - close to the metro! rooms are tiny, bathroom is bigger then the room! :-) we had two beds, table and tiny Tv set hanging up in the ceiling. basically we did not case - we had place to sleep - all the time walking in London. Do not take it on BB basis - breakfast in awful... awful is even not the word....just round the corner there is good irish pub... better have breakfast there. In general if u are not ready to pay real fortune to stay in hotel facing hyde park and u come to london for sightseeing - then this is perfect hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Your money is better spent elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Deakus
Reviews.Content: 160 quid a night for a small hot room with no air conditioning. Think Steve McQueen in the great escape and you're not far wrong. Take a baseball glove and ball and you're good to go. Seriously, just stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llowes
Reviews.Content: We were quite worried about our stay because we had read quite a lot of poor reviews, but we didn't have any problems other than having to wait for our breakfast as there aren't enough seats in the breakfast area. Our room was clean, all the facilities worked, although the shower was not easy to use. The hotel is fine if you want a budget hotel which is convenient for shopping, going to the theatre and visiting all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Night visit from a MOUSE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dafyda
Reviews.Content: I can write a lot of this hotel but there is something so nasty that anything else good or bad simply don't matter. We had a MOUSE IN OUR ROOM!!!! He served himself with some sweets we had in the room and when I get up from the bed, he simply run away in front of my eyes!! It was a teryfing experience... We called reception desk immediatelly (it was 1 o'clock in the night) and the guy was nice to change our room with another one; Anyway, AWFUL EXPERIENCE!

Reviews.Title: “One Star...Because Zero Isn't An Option. NEVER stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_Sheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on May 14th with my husband. Disaster from the start. Completely disgusted and would never stay here again nor would I recommend it to friends unless they had a demolition licence. Check-in is stated as 2pm. We actually arrived early and called in to see where the hotel was, and was told to return at 2pm which we did. After checking in we were asked to wait, our rooms were ready at 3pm. Our room was situated on the 1st floor, and we were directed to use the back stairs to get to it. Carpets and walls were stained throughout the tiny narrow corridors, and walking past the kitchen there was a rather unpleasant smell. Traversing the corridor is made all the more fun by the obstacle course of abandoned hoovers, piles of laundry, and black refuse sacks left in random corners. All doors squeaked, creaked or banged (including the one situated right outside our room) . The room... Tiny room. This would have been easily overlooked given the age of the hotel, were it not for the disgusting condition of the room. Walls, carpet, curtains and base of bed stained repeatedly throughout (bed appeared to have water damage). Damaged, mis-matched furniture, broken and stained. Very sharp broken edge on the desk. Open screw-holes in the wall where a headboard had obviously been removed, and many other holes in the wall where pictures, fixtures, etc had obviously been removed. Stained, mis-matched bedding, very old, blanket pilled and tatty, and the bedspread appeared to be a single attempting to cover a double bed. Dirty spare blanket in the wardrobe (strange smell in there too), but no spare pillows. Two flat, stained pillows on the bed. Window latch falling off, window impossible to close without balancing precariously on the edge of the bed. TV very old and dirty, had four poor-reception terrestrial channels, no sound on any of them no matter how high the volume was turned, and no remote. There were NO fire regulations/directions anywhere in the room at all (every drawer and wardrobe was checked). I was under the impression that this was illegal/against regulations? No air-conditioning, and building work made spending any time in the room with the window open unbearable. We tried to grab some sleep that afternoon which we found impossible due to the building work. VERY noisy, building work and cleaning staff (believe it or not given the state of the rooms they actually have a cleaner, we saw her) during the day, guests crashing around and noise from the street at night. No instructions for phone, ie how to contact reception/other rooms. Back of radiator clogged with dust and dirt, and smelled bad. No lock on bathroom door, door handle didn't work properly. Broken/cracked tiles and very dirty grouting, particularly in corners. Floor very uneven. Toilet seat broken and wobbly. Pedal bin not working. On closer inspection realised this was because the lid was completely detatched and balanced on in position to make it look as if it was still attached. Toilet took at least three button-pushes to complete a proper flush. Larger persons squashed up (ie, actually touching both sides) of wall and shower cubicle when using the toilet. Water pressure passable. Taps on sink very stiff to turn, especially cold. Towels were clean, with a nice fresh smell of detergent, however the bath towels were minute. As I was taking all of this in in my husband found the crowning glory to our stay...A Rentokil Rodenticide trap behind the bedside cabinet. *shudder* Husband and I both slept fully dressed on top of the bed covers to avoid having to actually touch the horrible bedding. On check-in the receptionist was very helpful, and the lobby appears much better than in previous reviews, now being finished in white marble with leather furniture for guests and smart reception/concierge desks. Initial appearances give no indication of the horrors within. Concierge was surly and with (it seemed) very poor English. I skipped breakfast at the hotel ("mouse traps in the rooms, what's going on in the kitchen?!" mentality), however my husband's review: Had to wait 20 minutes for a table. No bacon in cooked breakfast. Poor toaster, had to put bread through twice to achieve a decent colour! Only one person clearing tables. No recognisable brands on display. Yoghurts not cold. During our stay my husband stopped in at reception to purchase two bottles of water from a fridge beside reception (water or cans of Coke, no prices on display). Member of staff behind reception charged him Â£3 cash, didn't ask for a name or room number. When it came time to check out, two bottles of water had been charged to room service on our friend's room next door. On trying to explain that we had already paid cash, we were met with a grilling on time of purchase, who did we pay, what did they look like, how much did we pay, suspicion and assurances that "If the takings do not show Â£3 up, your booking card will be charged." Our complaints about the room and specifically the mouse trap were literally glossed over, our comments were not even acknowledged the receptionist continued the conversation with "Thank you for staying, enjoy the rest of your day." Also the hotel attempted to take payment four days before we were due to check in from the card left supposedly just to hold the room until we paid on check-in. After putting the money "On hold" on the card (takes five days to get it lifted), staff then attempted to charge us again and deny that they could simply use the money that they had put on hold, despite us having an e-mail from the hotel confirming that this was possible. Badly maintained and badly run. Overall I was completely disgusted with the hotel, there is no way in hell this is a three-star hotel. Had we had another option we would have checked out immediately after seeing the room, unfortunately we were stuck.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , under construction, price acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay here during April 14-16, room and bed is clean( room 510), shower is not satisfy .Overall is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..under construction”
Reviews.Author: abrostr1
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the tube. Within walking distance to bars and restaurants. Staff helpful. Small rooms were expected and OK with us-that's just Europe! Breakfast was adequate. Lobby/reception is under construction at time of travel. We were only in the hotel to sleep and shower so it met our needs. Kinda noisy at night with window open..recommend closing window and using earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Tiny and Terible”
Reviews.Author: Wa5te
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap overnight stay in London and booked this last minute. Due to the ongoing refurb on the ground floor, the reception was a tiny 3M x 3M with stairs to the first floor to catch an Elevator. The corridor was barely 4ft wide and the floor is uneven with creaky floorboards everywhere. The room was Very Small and the walls are paper thin. The rooms are in desperate need of a paint job and the carpet in my room had a large bleach stain by the shower room. The room TV only has the basic analogue channels and the picture quality was lousy. The shower room was clean and adequately sized. The continental breakfast is a joke, Soft rolls shaped like croissants, bland sliced cheese, tinned fruit pieces and a toaster that burns bread on one side and doesnâ€™t toast the other. For me it was just a somewhere to lay my head for one night but I certainly would not consider using this hotel for any longer than one night. It would drive me to depression staying any longer.

Reviews.Title: “I would consider staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Lowey007
Reviews.Content: Having booked last minute then reading the reviews i was dreading the stay andhave to say when they didnt have our booking on arrival things looked even worse. However, despte the booking error not being the hotels fault and them having a virtually fully booked hotel, they sorted the issue and within 20 mins we were being shown to our triple room. Please note the ritz this is not, it is presently going through an extensive refurb and as such on 1st appearances this place is a mess but the bedroom, albeit very basic was very clean as was the shower room / toilet with a TV with freeview that worked (to my daughters delight) with a great signal. Breakfast which was included was good; you have a choice of continental with fresh fruit and the obligatory toast machine or cooked consisting suasages, scrambled eggs, beans, mushrooms and tomatoes. (I had one sausage saying that day 1 and it was over fried and not very healthy so stayed clear after one bite!!). My gripe about breakfast was the mad rush that saw us wait 10 minutes for a table on day 2, day 1 was fine. The area was great and so handy (3 - 4 minutes walk) for Queensway tube station (3 direct stops from Oxford Circus) and a street load of shops/restaurants. Dont beleive what other reviews say about the area as we have a 5 year old girl and got in late both nights we stayed and didnt feel at all worried / threatened about the area. My only question about staying there again would be the cost, if you get it at the right cost (circa Â£100 per night per room incbreakfast) then everything considered its great value, anything more and Premier Inns plus special deals come into play. The hotel is not in the Congestion zone and an NCP car park at Â£25 per day is oposite the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid avoid”
Reviews.Author: Erin068
Reviews.Content: OH GOD!! It was actually so horrific, that it was hysterical. Firstly, we couldn't find it as there's no sign on it, it looks like an old run down hostel for the world from the outside, Then, trying to get our bags to our rooms was terrible - Lifts, hahaha, the bags wouldn't even fit in it was hysterical, tears coming down my face at this stage. So we walked down the stairs with the bags, i have bigger muscles now! The room, oh god, horrific. Different coloured carpets, supposed to be three beds, so there was a double, and two singles, but only two pillows, when we asked for more, we were told there were no more. Shower nozzle was the hold yourself type or don't have one!!!!!!! Not a great neighbourhood to be walking around either..AVOID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice if management cared”
Reviews.Author: IndyDenise
Reviews.Content: During our visit renovations on the hotel check in/business area were undergoing rennovations. I can deal with that ( though, it did cause problems since I needed the business area). Lack of hot water is a HUGE issue here, it is a ongoing and current problem. Don't stay here if you like to be clean, period. Guests were given several excuses on this matter but the truth is the hotel knows this is an issue and they are not dealing with it in a timely matter. (( I will be speaking to Virgin Vacations about this!! )) The rooms were not bad, I know this isn't the Ritz and I was not expecting much to be honest. What did surprise me was that apathy of the staff..no one cares. The same "Don't forgot to change your clocks tonight ahead one hour " sign was on the wall by the elevators for days..no one there could be bothered to take it down. Also, it could be cleaner, the corridors need cleaned..it was pretty weird to see staff walk by trash and not be bothered to pick it up. The breakfast room staff has a nasty attitude. One girl in particular yelled " it isn't open yet" in the snottiest voice as we were walking past . We had no plans to eat there that day ( had an early tour planned ) but we wanted to find out where the room was ..and the next day when we did do breakfast she walked around very unfriendly and gets upset if you get a clean plate to revisit the food. She just oozes "I should not be working with the public" . The front desk is okay, they are not warm and welcoming. Also, if you need a taxi don't book the overpriced shuttle the hotel will try to get you into..step outside and hail a cab...don't pay 30.00pds for a 8.00pd taxi ride. All in all if you don't expect hot water, or a caring staff then book here. If you are looking for a basic room that is a place to sleep and a chance to be on the shower lottery then this is the place for you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anaira
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying here after reading some of the reviews, but after having stayed here was pleasantly surprised. It's a budget hotel and you get way you pay for. If you are expecting 5 star accomodations at a 2 star rate, you're setting yourself up for disapointment. The size of the room is typical of a European hotel, not very big but enough space to move around. In order to watch TV, we had to ask for a remote control from the front desk. The breakfast room was the nicest area of the hotel, having recently been remodeled. The breakfast was good and there was plenty of food each morning. The elevators are small which is also typical, so not very surprising. I fit a huge suitcase, a small carry-on suitcase and myself just fine. The walls in our room were rather thin, so we could hear our neighbors which would be an issue if I wasn't such a heavy sleeper. The hot water does go in and out a bit, but it never got so cold that it was unconfortable or unbearable. The best part of the hotel is the location, just around the corner from the Queensway tube stop. The Bayswater tube stop is also close as is a bus stop. Plenty of restaurants and souvenir shops around the corner as well as grocery stores. Overall it's a decent hotel for the price. Could use some updating, but it's functional and in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!”
Reviews.Author: Wolvesmad33
Reviews.Content: We booked this place as it seemed in a good location and was reasonably priced and it looked OK from the pictures and description on various websites I browsed before deciding.First impressions were not good, old, tatty reception, resturaunt was closed for refurbishment which was supposed to be completed 2 weeks before we stayed. The lifts were so small you couldnt fit 2 people in with luggage so we went to the 4th floor by stairs. the corridors are so narrow that you cant pass another person with luggage without one person giving way.the whole place is grubby and tired. The " lavish" room we were staying in was supposed to be "recently refurbished" with sat TV, radio, trouser press and other stuff that wasnt there.It was pokey, grubby, the shower was useless, the bathroom was so small you had the sink right over you when you sat down.The toilet seat was broken and brerakfast was in a paper bag in the room due to refurb. I imagine now that the refurb has probably been completed this will not make a blind bit of difference. Now the good bits....er er none apart for location and thats it. AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Not the Waldorf Astoria, but a simple, clean convenient place to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: SomewhereinFlorida
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery of the Queen's Park after reading the reviews, but after staying there for three nights, I really don't understand the issues people have had there. Yes, it's small, but how much room does one need to sleep in and if you aren't asleep, why would you spend time in your hotel room when you could be out exploring London? Yes, the floor is creaky, but this is not surprising given the age of the building. We were not on the top floor and had people above us, and the creaking was not significant enough to bother us at all. The hotel was undergoing renovations, when I was there mid March 2011, but this progress was not obtrusive in any way. The hotel was clean, in a fantastic location near a tube station, restaurants and a grocery store and a huge, hot English breakfast was available each morning in the breakfast room. The staff was friendly and helpful. Note: the pictures on the Trip Adviser website of the teeny tiny elevator, are totally accurate -- it was hilarious. Four people could only fit in that elevator if two people were standing on the shoulders of two other people. There is however a second larger elevator right next to the tiny one if you are claustrophobic. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Can't see what the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: JoSands
Reviews.Content: I was a bit anxious about staying here after reading the awful reviews but I can't believe how wrong they were! We payed Â£32 to stay for one night. We found booking through their website was cheaper than last minute! So, considering it was so cheap i definitely wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was. Yeah the room was quite small, but so what. Still plenty of room to change and faf about. It was really clean and the bed was nice and comfy. The breakfast (which was a bonus!) was a nice start to the day. Planned on going out for breakfast but we got the continental breakfast which was more than enough. One slight downer was that once i got in the shower and put shampoo on and shower gel on the hot water went off. So i had no choice but to continue the shower in ice cold water. I'm sure some people would go bonkers over this but i couldn't be bothered considering how little we payed. Would recommend and stay here again. Hope some people will find this helpful. Also, right next to Hyde park and tube stations. Was perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for an Inexpensive Hotel...Helpful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: murphyteacher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Queens Park Hotel in mid February for 6 nights. I have been in many 3 star hotels in London and this hotel is not that bad! The room was small but clean. The breakfast was more than ample with two croissants, an apple, yogart, orange juice, and a cereal bar. This was delivered to the room and yes, I was informed by email prior to my arrival about this. The location is fantastic. There are several buses that stop at the end of the street plus 2 tube stations a 5 minute walk away. Kensington Gardens is also at the end of the street. During my stay, I broke my shoulder while I was on a sight seeing tour. The staff was kind, very accomodating and helpful making sure that I was well cared for during the balance of my stay there. Yes, this is a BUDGET hotel and when you book you need to remember that. If you expect 5 star accomodations, then spend your money and book at the Ritz!! I found the Queens Park Hotel a good value for the money spent!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely appauling hotel”
Reviews.Author: elainetrickett
Reviews.Content: arrived home last night after a 4 day break staying at the queens park hotel bayswater, booked by my children through superbreak for my 50th birthday, the hotel is in a super location ideal for all the sights but the hotel, well thats another matter, rooms not clean you could scrape dirt off the internal side of the window frames, the wooden toilet seat had all chips and chuncks out of it, tv did not work bed linen just about scrapped through, breakfast wa a laugh, dining room was closed so breakfast was served in your room, it arrived in a small brown paper bag and consisted of a small carton of juice, a dry croissant, jam and butter, yogurt, cereal bar and apple, with a small plastic spoon and knife no fresh tea or coffee you had to use your courtsey tray and you had to eat off your bed as there was no table or chairs, no appologies were made and where it gets its 3* status from I do not know I would not give it 1, staff are ignorant and un-helpful, all this put a dampner on what was a lovely trip, we had to make the best of a bad situation. disgruntled from Barnsley

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Decent.....”
Reviews.Author: Sudlow
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 506 (top floor) from the 10th to 16th as part of a package from go- today.com. The room appears to have recently been refurbished. Like others, i was interested in the reality because of the very mixed revuews this hotel has received. First the bad: The hot water stinks. On the 16th I got into the shower at 8:20. at 8:25 the hot water stopped and did not come back for 80 minutes! This happened two other days, but the outages weren't that long. If you're an early riser, except in very busy times you'll probably be OK. Stuff that's not so bad: The inside of the shower is 24 inches square. To get fully clean, I had to lean outside of the shower. To sit on the toilet, you have to actually slide yourself under the edge of the sink. This is a bathroom for the semi-agile. My room was very small. A single bed, small desk & chair and a clostet. That's it. But perfectly serviceable. The elevators are small. One is 2X4 feet, the other 3X4. Typical of many older/smaller hotels in Europe and perfectly useable. The breakfast is small and not the best. But really, if you stay at this sort of hotel and expect a solid breakfast, you're a bit delusional. If you want a remote for your TV, just ask. I can only guess that they had so many lost/stolen they only give them out on request. I did not find the noise excessive. Noise from the adjoining rooms could be heard, but was no worse than any other budget hotel. There are loud groups in the street at night, generally around 11. Again, not too bad and usually only for a few minutes as they went in for the night. The good stuff: Location. Price. Clean room, comfortable bed. Would I stay here again? If the price was right, yes. If I could save a lot of money by staying here, I'd make a point of getting up early to use the shower. Otherwise, no. If I wasn't traveling solo, then I would not consider this hotel. It is not for romantic getaways or special occasions. It's a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoHel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend and I must say that I was disappointed by the quality of the room. When I arrived there I thought that everything seemed to be fine, since the room was in my view clean and bright. The problems were the breakfast bags (eating two dry croissants isn't breakfast), the shower didn't have enough water pressure to shower under and the absence of remote control for the tv. I of course complained about this to the reception, but they couldn't be bothered about it. So I have made a formal complaint to the travel agent who booked this hotel for me, I didn't get the value that I paid for. The worst thing was that the shower didn't work, I thought it was the biggest fault a hotel can have

Reviews.Title: “place should be bulldozed”
Reviews.Author: partyblonde
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed there this weekend for my birthday and our engagement. ... so where do we start. not with anything good to say thats for sure. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE! 1) our room was no good because the shower was blocked. It took another 4 rooms before we got one ... n that still had a dodgy shower,but it 11pm by now. 2) The place was dirty. 3) Apart from 2, the staff we not helpfull, and hardly any spoke English. 4) No phones in rooms on 5th floor so beware! 5) The water system, especially on 5th floor,was a joke. Showers worked when they wanted, the water was cold, if you were lucky to get water flow it was poor. 6) Only midgets can access the lifts - no morethan 2 at a time, and without bags! 7)Breakfast was a joke. Their was no mention on websites of the dining room being closed. If you do book continental breakfast, hope you like apples n cold coissants! But what they dont tell you is you can get a ticket in exchange to have a cooked breakfast in hotel across road. 8) Oh, and they cheeking monkeys ask for payment when you arrive. DONT DO IT. Pay only on departure. We paid nothing and cancelled card the following morning so they cant take the money! Overall, i really enjoyed it ... NOT! it was disgusting. Fawlty Towers is Buckingham Palace compared to this s***hole. Thanks for ruining my birthday/engagement Queens Hotel -Hotel? Thats a joke!!!!! I should have guessed something wasnt right with the place when i checked in - as i walked in, 4 rats with their suitcases walked out.

Reviews.Title: “hotel manager not bothered.just says take it up with agent you booked with.”
Reviews.Author: lesmel52
Reviews.Content: IN our opinion all the negative reviews we agree with because that was our experience.When you complain he says take it up with agency you booked with they were informed of building work and should have told you.But that does not excuse the hotel because there is still no mention of building work and dining room being closed all january and possibly february on queens park hotel website

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but not as horrific as people say”
Reviews.Author: Hellymoosex
Reviews.Content: Before our trip I was absolutely terrified about going to this hotel. Luckily, upon arrival I was surprised. The location of the hotel is excellent, a short walk from the Queensway Station, on the central line and Bayswater on the circle and district line. Upon arrival we were able to check in early, the lobby of the hotel is nothing fancy, a bit dark and soulless. In general the reception, lobby and corridors of the hotel are in need of a refurbishment, but our bedroom was modern, clean and compact and for the price we has paid of just over Â£80 for two nights for both of us we could not complain. With regards to the breakfast due to the dining area being closed the food provided wasn't horrendous, I was slightly unhappy we had not been informed of the refurb prior to our booking but seeing as we had not paid extra like you do at many hotels in London, it was not a major issue. The only other minor negative of this hotel is the corridors at night, as you can often easily hear people coming past and the doors within the corridors do not always shut properly and slam. This didn't affect us severely for several reasons; 1. We are both students, who are used to living in busy and noisy halls of residence/ houses, 2. We had such busy days and evenings going round the city that we were both shattered by the time we got back to the hotel we fell straight to sleep. Nevertheless, this could be an issue for some people who may wish to stay here. Overall, we had a fantastic break and really enjoyed our time in London. I would recommend the Queens Park Hotel to anyone on a budget wanting a clean, basic hotel to use as a base whilst visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “disgrace, disgusting.....should be closed down!”
Reviews.Author: muricia1951
Reviews.Content: Arrived to hotel . as soon as we entered reception area which looked like a dump/building site!! With scabby furniture , paint peeling off walls. We checked in, and we were explained about having our breakfast in a bag (ridiculous) because breakfast area was been refurbished, nothing about this when we booked - very misleading. We continued on to go and see our room, waiting for the lift, the geenral cleanliness was horrific. dirty walls , door knobs, dirty handprints all over walls. as we walked to the rooms the floor was even sinking! Got tot he damp smelling room. Dirty looking bed covers with blankets you wouldnt even use for the farm animals. We decided to check out and explained to receptionist we are disgusted with quality of hotel. She then replied 'ok' , 'no problem' !! - Please book else where, dont waste your time with this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jan Travellers rethink your trip hotel if this one is your choice”
Reviews.Author: ajay64
Reviews.Content: arrived on 11 Jan for 4 night stay, anxious as read the reviews, had an open mind .. oh boy.. first you approach the hotel to see paint peeling off the entrance door, and a filthy outdoor light, I went in, and.... more paper peeling off the walls, the doors were filthy with dirty hand marks ingrained on the door parts that they actual push on, the furniture in reception was minimal and all was dull and very run down, I am thinking dump .... we checked in to be told... the breakfast dining area is closed for January (and maybe Feb so check) their was no mention of this on the websites or booking sites, it should state this, we would not have bothered, so breakfast arrives in a bag to your door, unfit croissants wrapped in cling film and warm yoghurt, no tea or coffee...terrible, no towels in the bathroom, sweat stains on the pillows, they didnt wash ours.. window so dirty you could barely see out of it, room not very clean, walls dirty and shabby, curtain all un stitched, wouldnt be surprised if the beds arent full of bugs, didnt want to put my head on the sweat stained pillows, beds are not comfy either, no sugar in room, they dont care once your there, I complained to be told Manager not there, I saw Manager today 13 Jan 2011, he says it is mentioned about breakfast on your bed in a bag on the web site.... see for yourself.. it is not... we wanted 2 nights refunding, we were told the Manager would and re-book elsewhere, I said not likely until money refunded.... Manager did not refund our money so good job we didnt go elsewhere and pay even more... and dont forget people walking around all night up and down the hotel talking on their mobiles loudly and no remote for t.v. no info in the room about anything, phone doesnt work, no numbers or anything to call incase you need anything... its horrible Please ... look elsewhere, dont make our mistake, its a dump... its a one star at a push...

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget weekends away”
Reviews.Author: JC2010186363
Reviews.Content: Primarily picked this hotel because of our budget. Fully expected to "rough it" as students, but was actually pleasantly surprised. Stayed in one of the newly refurbished rooms, and it was very pleasant. Room sizes are quite small, but has all tea/coffee making facilities, TV, and plenty of storage space. Bathroom was tidy and clean (although the door didn't close properly), and the shower was very nice. Was surprised with the room quality, it was actually very pleasant. The best thing about this place was the location. It was located literally a minute walk from Hyde Park, and there were two tube stations (Queensway and Bayswater) located within 5 minutes walking distance. There were also plenty of local shops (a Tesco Express next to Queensway) so easy to get access to food or pubs etc in the area. The reception area/hallways were quite old and this was evident throughout (save for the room which had been recently refurbished). The lifts were also very small and quite claustrophobic (we decided to take the stairs instead). The hotel IS being refurbished so I imagine it would be a lot nicer this time next year, though it wasn't bad by any standards. The hotel staff were very friendly and very helpful. I don't understand the negative reviews, as I found the staff to be really helpful. The lady behind the counter gave us advice on booking last minute theatre tickets and was very friendly. Continental breakfast was average - we didn't upgrade to the full-English (for only an extra Â£2 PP), but it was fine. Didn't expect to get breakfast, and it was included in the price and, although the variety was limited, there was choice available. One thing I would say is that there was very limited seating areas - some people that came after us had to wait for others to finish because they couldn't be seated. I would personally recommend it for people staying one to three nights. I think anything longer might be a little uncomfortable, but I guess it's all about what you're used to. Don't expect five star, I would rate it as 3 stars overall.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, new bathrooms, unacceptable help from staff, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: peaksgram
Reviews.Content: a very disappointing stay at the Queens Park Hotel, it is convenient to the tube, the concierge was not able to help with most of our requests, the desk staff could not help with placing an international call, the breakfast was minimal and not appealing. Only one lift was in operation (and it is very small)....

Reviews.Title: “Bad porter staff!”
Reviews.Author: Stevens6
Reviews.Content: There is one member of staff who ignored me when i asked him to move my luggage, he pretended i wasn't even there. the reception staff was really nice and I understood that he couldn't do anything about it, this porter was watching Formula one instead of helping guests. the hotel is nice, rooms are great and the situation of the hotel is fine! the breakfast is also fine and the roomservice is pretty good, to bad for some rotten apples in the basket....

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel- You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: matthirst
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and it is very much a budget hotel.The location is very good with Queensway tube station 5 minutes walk away.The building itself is elegant from the outside.Inside ,well the reception area is basic but adequate and the staff very pleasant. Thereis no bar / separate lounge area.The lift situaution is as previously documented by other reviewers with one lift broken(permananly?) and one small lift working.Our room on the 5th floor was very clean and comfortable although not very spacious.Main issue was the shower which trickled in the evenings and there was no hot water at all for the first 2 mornings we stayed.The breakfast was quite adequate with bread rolls,toast and cereal.The breakfast room is too small for all the guests staying and there were queues each morning to try and grab a table.In fairness though you get what you pay for and the hotel does offer budget accomodation at budget prices.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away and DO NOT STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: 5rweinmd
Reviews.Content: This is a last resort place. Hey all, if you want to sleep----FORGET it!!! There is a 8 story Youth Hostel directly across the street and they party, loudly all night.. The youth have to leave the Hostel to smoke, and guess where they go??? Directly onto the street and sidewalk in front of the Hotel...All Night Teen Party!!! Twin room??? Ha!! We had to basically jump over the crushed together twin beds to get to the bathroom. The staff if friendly but we had nails and screws sticking out of our room carpet, peeling paint and wallpaper, bare bones continental breakfast all down a seedy street . We did not sleep for three days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel,fantastic location,great staff”
Reviews.Author: Leverage0504
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel,it's not luxury hotel,but it is perfect,the rooms are great very clean,with everything you might need,the bathroom was fantastic clean and spacious.The hotel staff is fantastic,we had a concierge that explained everything about the sights and gave us tips about all London,so all in all we'll come there again next year ,because it's really really good.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Tufty59
Reviews.Content: Having just spent one night at this hotel we felt some criticisms unjustified. Considering the location (so close to numerous 'sights' in the heart of London) it was a good price. Yes, the rooms are small but well equipped. New bathroom/shower and freshly painted walls only spoilt by the carelessness of previous guests appearing to scrape their luggage along them and leaving dirty marks.
