Good choices for a continental breakfast. Downside undoubtedly the lift - far too small and rather ancient - and only one working. Unable to use our room safe as it had been locked by a previous guest on leaving and no-one was available on reception to unlock it for us.

Reviews.Title: “No value for money”
Reviews.Author: VickiHamburg
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to start by saying that when I contacted the hotel via e mail requesting a room without carpets and one with windows that open onto a road, my request was honoured. My husband and I were very disappointed with the shabbiness of the hotel reception and the fact that only one lift was working as the other lift was out of order since before 23rdJuly 2010 as a note on the 5th floor had a paper attached to the lift promising the clients that the lift will be in order by then. The only lift in operation was about one and a half feet deep by four feet wide. The room was very very clean but so small that there was a small table on one side of the bed. The room had no air condition nor a fan and the weather was quite warm in the twenties. On departure we were asked to pay for leaving our suitcases in a safe place and this was never quoted on their website. Breakfast was consisting of canned fruit salad, bread, jams and fruit juice. I dont think that we got value for money and would never recommend this hotel to anyone. When I complained with both the receptionist and the gentleman who looks after the tours all I got from this gentleman was that one can never please everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money... you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: HmmmCake
Reviews.Content: 'I stayed there with my friends for a few days. The reception was helpful, friendly and the rooms were tidy and clean. I missed the breakfast but that didn't bother me much. Good location... Hyde Park is around the corner and I was able to walk to Oxford St. too. Pricing was very reasonable for London. You really get what you pay for... it's not a 5 star Â£300 a night hotel and so I didn't expect to get a lot of amenities. The main thing for me was that the rooms were clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that the "concierge" was never there when needed. We waited a long time until he came to help us with the tickets for a bus tour in the morning and he didn't seen very attentive when we wanted to pick up our bags either. That really irked me... if you hate your job then leave and get another one... don't make my vacation more hassle.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: thejourneywithin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was on a short trip last month. The hotel was located central to where I needed to be, which was a big plus. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but since I wasn't there for much more than sleep, it wasn't much of a concern of mine, though if my stay had been longer it may have felt a bit too cramped. The staff was friendly and took care of any questions that I had. Overall, if I need to be in the area again for anything, I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside, but ...”
Reviews.Author: visitorMD
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated at less than 5 minutes walk from 2 metro stations (Bayswater/Queensway) and as regarded from the outside a beautiful building, this hotel rapidly turns over into a very awful accommodation. The first problem you encounter is the elevator.When arriving with four persons with in total 2 medium suitcases (bags) and you have to mount to the fifth floor you might expect an elevator large enough to lift you up .There are two of them : one not functioning and the other one suited to get only one (not claustrophobic) person with 2 bags up to the wanted rooms. The other guests have to mount the stairs. You arrive in your room to find out that it is very small , that the safe doesn't open and the water heater doesn't function, nor does the hairdryer. The curtains are damaged and the mirror in the wardrobe is broken.In the other room n the safe does not open either. In the bathroom the shower gives nothing (certainly not hot water). When we signal it to the reception they promise to do something about it, but nothing happens. The next day we go downstairs to breakfast and first we have to wait because the too small dinner room is occupied. The breakfast itself consists of very moderate bread to toast + "croissants" I didn't even finish and corn flakes. There is also fruit salad (out of tin) . There were no eggs, meat (bacon, sausages or salami) , yoghourt, not even choco or cheese. We were very happy we only booked for 2 nights in that hotel and the next breakfast we had was at the Starbucks in the neighbourhood. Other item : the toilets on the ground floor are not clean. Luckily for us, we didn't have to stay all the time in this hotel. The weather was not bad and London has so many wonderful places to visit we easily could do without this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LazyHampshire
Reviews.Content: Booked through superbreak for a 2 night theatre package. Wonderful greeting at reception, helpful staff. Small room as we would expect in central London but clean with everything we needed in it, comfy bed and an impressive shower in a newly updated en-suite bathroom. Quiet at night, although the fire alarm went off quite early in the morning but was quickly stopped and we were able to get back to sleep. Breakfast was basic but plenty of choice. Internet available. Lovely area with a park at the end of the road with nice walks into London past Kennsington Palace and Princess Diana Memorial fountain. Local shops and restraunts at the other end of the street and 2 tube lines within a 2 minute walk, location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “For the money and the location, I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: billinwilliamston
Reviews.Content: The location is great! When we booked it, this was far and away the cheapest in-suite hotel in tube zone 1. There are certain compromises you have to make when booking budget travel. The room was small (Did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). The free breakfast was a simple continental affair, no decaf available like most of Europe, but it could be filling (did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). The room was clean, but the carpet and wall were stained (did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). The bathroom was clean and well stocked for a budget hotel, but definitely a one person affair (did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). The TV only had a few (3 or 4) channels (did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). Wireless is available in the lobby for a charge, but not in the rooms (did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). One real negative thing is the aforementioned fire alarm going off every night. It was quite disrupting (did I mention it was the cheapest in-suite hotel in zone 1?). I understand that people who are not used to budget travel might find lots of fault with this place, but what I don't understand are the complaints about the staff. Everyone we dealt with was absolutely friendly and helpful. We were always greeted and made to feel like we were valued guests.

Reviews.Title: “Really regretted staying here! Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugNZ78
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights and so happy to leave. It started off with poor desk service. The receptionist was very off hand and disinterested. We had to pay the full amount up front before even seeing the room. Going up to our room we had the experience of the smallest lift ever seen. It barely fit us with one suitcase each and not good for anyone who is slightly claustrophobic! After leaving the lift walked through very dirty corridors with carpet that looked like it had not been cleaned for a couple of weeks. When we got to the room which was very small it was criminally hot - it would have been over 30 degrees celcius even with the window open! Within about 2 minutes we were in a sweat. There was no air conditioning and after talking to reception found out that only a couple of the floors have A/C (but there is only one control per floor!) - we were on the 5th which is a new floor and no a\c had yet been set up! When we asked for a fan we were told they didn't have any! The Internet which the hotel listed as being provided at a charge (Â£5 for 3 hours) was down for 2 of the 3 days we were there with varying reasons as to why it wasn't available with the receptionists just shrugging their shoulders and saying "maybe tomorrow". It finally became available on our last day where we could access it using our laptop in the lobby (not available in guest rooms). We were desperate to get in touch with family but did not have a phone in our room either (just a jack point). When we checked with staff we found out that the rooms on our floor had not been wired up with a phone yet - "I can find you a phone but it won't work". Great! We only had breakfast for one of the three mornings because it was not good - very bland and a poor selection of stale rolls and cereal. The only slightly good thing about the hotel was that the room had a fairly good bathroom and shower. It is not worth it though - if you have any other option take it as this would be an absolute last choice - I would rather sleep in a hostel than take this place again. We had to pay Â£150 per night for this experience which is a complete rip off - I would be annoyed to even pay half of that for this type of accommodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Not one good word to say about this shoddy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ComeOnTim
Reviews.Content: Our hopes were high on arrival after seeing an Aston Martin and Range Rover parked outside, but soon shot down as we got inside, had to pay upfront, walk past an original Windows 95 computer and squeeze into a lift the size of a shoebox that took about 3days to go just a few floors. It was either that or use the maze of tight stairways to get there. So in no particular order, here's a list of reasons not to stay at this "hotel". - Tiny room - Bedside cabinets are a plank of wood with drawers that aren't even drawers - High dryer works at 5 second intervals before needing a 5 minute breather - No air-con or hint of a breeze so hot and sticky - Windows that go out onto the fire escape (not the safest or private) - Toilet that's basically in the shower - Toilet that wouldn't stop dripping and wouldn't refill properly - Shower door that wouldn't close so soaked the floor - Most uncomfortable, supposedly double, bed i've been in/on since they put an old woolen blanket on in it for some reason in the summer - TV that was too high on the wall and signal was shocking and had no remote - Cupboard that stank - Thin walls so you can hear everyone else complaining about their rooms aswell, and more - Awful breakfast; they somehow managed to get fresh orange juice wrong - Bathroom door that got stuck on the floor when opening One positive to mention though - the chair in the room was really nice, except it probably shouldn't have been in there considering that extra empty space in the room would have been useful

Reviews.Title: “NO ONE WANTS TO BE MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: DundeeSilverfox
Reviews.Content: Had a Weekend stay at the Queens Hotel and on the last night our groundfloor room was broken into. The hotel staff were of no help at all and kept telling us it would be passed onto the manager. We asked for the Police to be involved but knew little could be done by them although they were very helpful .We had to ask to be moved to another room for our last night. Next morning before we left we expected to meet the Hotel Manager only to be told he was again unavailable. Since arriving home I have contacted the hotel by phone and e:mail but I'm just wasting my time. The break-in was caused by a door in our room leading to the street not being secured.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel avoid!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ami234
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our very small rooms,the heat was unbearable with no air con or vans we went out as soon as we had dropped bags off.The Shower leeked all over the floor,After many trips to the reception, they could not care less and was very rude!!!, My friends stayed in two other room all with heating issues,broken tiles on shower,cracked window repaired with tape,burn marks,dirty wallls,safe that didnt work.

Reviews.Title: “Don't risk your family's health!”
Reviews.Author: newcastlecitybreaker
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by First Choice a TUI company acting for Superbreak and had no reason to expect it to be other than a clean and reasonable hotel as we were given thisl advice by a "reputable" travel organisation. On the eve of our visit I read the reviews whilst looking up the location in order to find out how to get there. I immediately booked an alternative hotel as I did not want to put our health at risk by staying there. I contacted Superbreak asking them to cancel my booking and refund my hotel bill. On my return I also contacted First Choice. Neither organisation has replied to my e-mails. They have not even attempted to refute the claims on Tripadvisor, leaving me with the only view that as long as they have your money they do not care where they locate you.

Reviews.Title: “Average, management advice poor, fire alarms go off 24/7, good position”
Reviews.Author: Johnmarine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being refurbished, the lifts need maintenance and the room was small but OK. The main concern is the poor management advice and the arrogance of the hotel manager. If you stay here make sure you understand the advice you are getting. Their financial return is more important than your satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “If you value your health and well being STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!”
Reviews.Author: cbaker17
Reviews.Content: I came home with scabies from this hotel. It is disgusting and I will NEVER stay here again. DO NOT believe the pictures that you see on the internet. The rooms do not look like that. They are dirty, with stains on the bedding and obviously bugs. The beds are not beds but movable cots that are so horrible that I had a back ache the entire 10 days of the hotel. As of that was not bad enough, the street outside was horribly loud all night long. Every night I was woken up at least 3 times. The lift is hazardous and yet I had to use it to get my luggage up the 4 flights of stairs. I never knew if I was going to make it once those doors closed. In addition to that, the food was disgusting- nothing fresh and dirty dishes. The only good things I can say about this hotel are the concierge from Ethiopia was very sweet and I was so GLAD to leave it. Honestly I got home on April 1st and had to go to the doctor as soon as I was home to get treated for the disease that I picked up from the hotel. It has now cost me over $200 for the doctor's visit and the ensuing treatment. HORRIBLE!!!!!! Also NO FREE wi-fi and although they advertise wi-fi it is only the lobby. Again they should face some sort of penalty for the false advertising! The business center is a computer stuck in the corner of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “horrible, worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ash872
Reviews.Content: Avoid at all costs! Accommodations are disgusting, strange stains on carpet, walls in unit and also in elevator! I constantly felt like things were crawling on me while sleeping in the bed. Two days later i broke out in a rash. Rooms are TINY, one single bed took up 2/3's of the room. Walls are paper thin, so don't expect any privacy. So thin you can hear guests from across the hall! Constant disruptions, rude Englishman barging in rooms, and slamming doors behind, fire alarm going off, construction inside and outside, clueless employees, continental breakfast is anything but continental. This place is a complete JOKE! And for comparable hotels in the same price range, you can find MUCH better! You have been warned! Even if you don't mind sleep in at a filthy place, you better be a deep sleeper, because you will never get a good nights rest. Staying here will ruin your trip to London, take my advice, don't book this place! BTW, WiFi is Â£2/hr, and you have to be in the lobby to receive it! Don't expect them to tell you this before you pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Free MOUSE with Visit”
Reviews.Author: SpeedySamScotland
Reviews.Content: Lots of the reviews we can relate to..Dirty carpets, random fire alarm, dis-interestest staff, small lift, noise from the street, but I reckon I can trumph them all. We had a MOIUSE in our room (311) on our first night!! Obviously, he was not impressed by the 'continental' breakfast because he went for our bag of mini eggs and had a good munch. Found a massive (by mouse standards) hole in the wall in the morning. Told staff...didn't even ask our room number. Bunged the hole with tissue as the hotel made no attempt to fill it.

Reviews.Title: “Discusting”
Reviews.Author: McDonaldScotland
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights in the hotel and the minute we got there it was awful, we complained to who we booked the break through and the moved us to another hotel for our 2nd night but we had to stay for the first night. It was so bad, i had never stayed anywhere as bad before it is like a youth hostel, room was dirty, on a complete slope, carpet patched up, walls filthy with holes in them, you couldnt walk round the bed as it was pushed up against the wall the room was sooooo small corridors were tiny The lift was tiny one person at a time if you have a suitcase, the carpet was covered in chewing gum, writing all over the door. It was so bad. Would NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting, dirty, smelly, small, false advertisement”
Reviews.Author: vicki040507
Reviews.Content: Service was terrible staff didnt understand what we were saying and very unhelpful. On arrival we found the lift was tiny, only one person could use at a time. After walk up 3 flights of stairs with our luggage we discover we were given a different room from the one we ordered. Eventually managed to get a triple room, which was small. The sheets had blood on, the mattresses were stained and ripped, the pillows were stained, curtains were hanging off the rails and in the tiny bathroom the curtain didnt even cover the whole window so people could see in. The room had not been dusted for a long time as there was dirt and dust in the window sill and on top of the lamps on the wall. There is no bar as advertised, no lounge, and breakfast was awful with no advertisement of the cooked breakfast you could order. A member of staff twice tried to come into our room whilst we were still in bed in the morning. The lobby floor was covered in chewing gum, and there was sick outside the main entrance. As for sat tv, we had 4 channels and 1 of those wasnt clear, no wi fi in rooms when I asked about the internet I was told it was Â£2 for an hour to use a computer in the main lobby.

Reviews.Title: “More like a youth hostel!!!”
Reviews.Author: loofer69
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say! Tiny lift with writing all over the inside of it, Carpets stained and lifting, Walls scraped and peeling, toilet didn't flush, no remote control, no bar, breakfast was poor, basically ive stayed in better backpackers!!! I know you get what you pay for, but when you pay for something you expect things to be clean and in reasonable condition!!! This should be a 1* rated hotel/youth hostel!!! The only good thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “just one word.....appauling!”
Reviews.Author: travellers12345
Reviews.Content: Positives first...the hotel is a few minutes walk from the Bayswater tube station. That's it for the positives i'm afraid. Tiny lift, peeling wall paper and paint throughout hotel. Tiny room, smaller than tiny bathroom with mould as an extra! Stains on carpet, bed very uncomfortable. The room absolutely stunk and we found that the smell was coming from a blanket in the wardrobe! We had to remove the blanket from the room, this wasn't difficult as there was a pile of junk in the corner outsside the room, my partner was gagging from the smell when she moved the blanket! Staff not helpful. Asked for an extra pillow which never arrived. Breakfast was dreadful. Fruit salad looked like they had been there for days and had been mashed! Fruit juice tasted like it had cordial and water added to it...so not fresh as advertised on website. We were given plastic glasses to have the juice in as they hadn't got enough. We ended up having to clear our own table afterwards as the waitress was nowhere to be seen and there were other guests waiting to come in. DO NOT believe the pictures on the actual website of the hotel!! We stayed at this hotel as part of a package deal with a show included, it was a cheap deal and we have learned our lesson!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the purpose”
Reviews.Author: Steele-2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights B&B on a package break in London.Hotel has a good position for sightseeing (about 100 metres from Hyde Park & 5 mins walk to Bayeswater or Queensway underground stations) Reception was efficient & quick.This hotel is being refurbished (and needs it)Our room had been refurbished, although it was very small but clean & was ok for our requirements.There is no Bar in the hotel & the restaurant was closed.You had to que for breakfast which was continental but no meat,cheese etc.I believe cooked breakfast was available for a price but it wasn't made known anywhere.Overall, adequate for a short sightseeing trip if you only need a bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: terdec
Reviews.Content: They can take a reservation but don't know how to hold it. Booked 3 twins, got 3 doubles. Had to fight to get one changed. Fire alarm went off at random times 4 out of the 6 days we were there. Elevators worked one day. The one person elevator worked 5 days out of 6 serving 5 floors. Peeling wallpaper, etc. good location and okay breakfast but otherwise beware.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC HOTEL...VERY GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jmjanderson
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was fairly basic but had everything you would expect ie) tv,hairdryer,kettle. Room was ok size, suitable for a few nights. Continental breakfast was disappointing as you get toast,croissants, cereal, tea or coffee, so not really continental. Location of hotel was good as you were close to local shops & restaurants & 2 tube stations, didn't take long to travel to see the sights in the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “basic but value 4 money”
Reviews.Author: michelle1812
Reviews.Content: my husband booked this trip 4 us at xmas at the bargain price of 69.99 4 2 nights bed and breakfast each.......when he looked on here at the reviews he was mortified as they were all really poor.told him not to worry as the amount of b and b's we have stayed in at blackpool ..............i rest my case. the hotel on first apperances was a bit grotty paint work wise but staff were friendly and our room was clean, beddin was fresh bathroom very small but clean and very powerful shower....although the breakfast was only toast and cereal i think its a great place to stay as a base 4 our capital....loved it !!!! also in an excellant location 4 the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Lot better than the reviews we had read before we went”
Reviews.Author: WestMidlandsCybil
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews we were dreading going in this hotel,After catchin the train to Euston and jumpin on the tube to queensway we had about a 2 minute walk to get to the hotel,We arrived early but were able to leave our cases while we went to get something to eat.The room should of been ready at 2.00 but they were still cleanin so it was about 3.00.This is the only problem we came across.The room was satisfactory very clean,the bed was very comfortable the shower was very good.We had to wait about 2 minutes to be seated for breakfast once we were seated there was plenty of food and drinks.People must realise this is not a 5 star hotel you pay for what you get,and what you pay for this hotel you couldnt expect anymore.And also you do not have to vacate your rooms until 12.00 so we were able 2 leave our cases in our rooms and go out for a bit..Then we we brought our cases down they look ed after them for us.When we needed a taxi to get to the station they were very helpful and called one for us.Would definetley stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC BUT CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: goldfish53
Reviews.Content: After having read other reviews my friend and I were somewhat apprehensive about this hotel but out fears were groundless. Yes, the photos look much better than the acutal place but having said that the rooms were clean and basic. The room was small but as we were only using it for sleeping it didn't really matter. The bedding was clean and fresh and, to our surprise, the rooms were cleaned while we were out even though we were only there for 2 nights. We had no bother with noise from other residents - maybe we were just lucky !! The lifts were small but we managed luckily neither of us are overweight. lol ! The hotel is situated about a 30 minute walk from Oxford St so not too bad. The Concierge, Robert, was very helpful and friendly. At the end of the day this is a cheap , basic hotel - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “No thrills budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: indie1982
Reviews.Content: We got booked in at this hotel as part of a package to London and having read through the reviews prior to going we really weren't looking forward to it. However, we knew we'd be out during the day and we'd literally just be using the hotel as a place to sleep so as long as the place was clean that's all we were really looking for. Check-in was swift with a pre-authorisation of a credit card or Â£20 cash to be left as a deposit (we opted for the cash option). Reception staff all spoke very good English and had a good knowledge of the area. As others have mentioned the 2 lifts in the hotel are small, one of them only just big enough for 2 people without luggage. Our room was on the third floor (308), thankfully one of the ones that had (recently?) been refurbished. The room was very small, slightly bigger than the double bed with a wardrobe, desk and en-suite bathroom. The bathroom was modern, tiled and clean with a shower cubicle, basin and toilet. However it was very cramped and there was little room to get dry after taking a shower. There's no A/C but the window opened wide and there's a radiator in the room you can control that got very hot, very quickly. Again, it's a budget hotel, we didn't expect A/C. The bed was comfy enough if a little bit creaky and the room also had a small flat screen TV mounted on the wall with terrestrial channels 1-5 available. However that's about as good as it gets... The fire alarm was constantly going off during the night. It seems they're very well rehearsed at diving across reception to stop the alarm as soon as someone presumably smoking in their room sets it off. We stayed for 3 nights and the alarm went off 4 times. The hotel was also very noisy, a small gap at the bottom of the door to our room let in all the noise from people walking the corridor and doors slamming. Having said all that, the hotel is well located with 2 Underground stations just streets away and Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park at the end of the road. To be honest if the fire alarm didn't keep going off and you were guaranteed one of the refurbished rooms, for what you pay it's not that bad if you're going to be out all day.

Reviews.Title: “To call it a dump would be an insult to that word.”
Reviews.Author: tonyuk36
Reviews.Content: Tiny Lift, peeling paint and wallpaper everywhere. tiny room. Tiny bathroom. Tiny mouse run around floor 5. Stains on sheets. Stains on carpet in room. Could not turn off radiator in room. Had to climb over wife to move around room. More could be said but I think that this was enough. We walked out and got another hotel within 1 hour of checking into this dump.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: LULU1515
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. The room was tiny and did not have a bedside light. The kettle base was held together with.....wait for it.......cardboard and sellotape! I kid you not. Old blankets on the bed. Reception seen better days. Breakfast was plentiful but don't get the tea. The bathroom was the best feature being clean and modern. Staff indiferrent. Good location though. Dog outside barked most of the night. Truly? Forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bluebell49
Reviews.Content: Peeling paint, peeling wall paper, rodent trap under bedside cabinet, dirty lift, rabbit warren of a hotel, blankets you wouldn't even put your dog on.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, with no frills.”
Reviews.Author: clive33
Reviews.Content: Worst night's sleep ever, lots of streets noise even with windows closed. Bed old and sloped to one side, bedding didn't fit. Poor budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely shocking!!!”
Reviews.Author: redbear81
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I travelled to London for some sightseeing and to see some shows. We booked this hotel as part of a theatre break and all we can say is that on the whole our trip to london was great but the hotel left a lot to be desired. On check-in we asked for a iron and iron board to be bought up to our rooms at which point the receptionist on duty gave us an iron (our hands were full with our luggage) and told us to get a board from the concierge desk. We maybe should have taken that as an indicator for the remainder of our stay. We went up to our room via two lifts as both of us and our luggage couldn't fit into just one lift. The one lift could hold just two people without any bags. The other was just slightly bigger. Both lifts are in desperate need of a refurb as is the rest of the hotel. When we got to our room we couldn't believe just how small it was. The room was the size of a single room with a double bed in it. If I wanted to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night I had to climb over my girlfriend as there wasn't enough space to get out of my side of the bed and walk around it. There were scuff marks on the walls, the carpet was grubby and generally the the room was in disrepair and in desperate need of a refurb. I also wanted to put some things in the room safe however I discovered that it was locked with no instructions on how to open it. I called down to reception and they said they would send someone up immediately. No one materialised even though I told them we would be leaving in a half hour. We went out to the theatre and upon our return we found that someone had been into the room and opened the safe and not left any instructions. We also noticed that there was no-one on reception when we got back (this was to be a common sight throughout our stay). Breakfast on all mornings was disorganised and chaotic with staff helping themselves to breakfast and eating behind the counter in full view of guests. They would also play on their phones and read the papers while the buffet was being neglected. The buffet was also nothing special. Two cereals, two fruit juices, tinned fruit salad and grapefruit segments, croissants, rolls, bread for toasting and tea and coffee. The toaster seemed to be faulty - it was on full heat, but you still had to put your toast through twice to just get a semblance of colour on it. The breakfast room itself was also shabby and how they coped with breakfast in that small room I don't know. It is best to get in first thing otherwise you might not have a table. The radiator in the room didn't have any means of turning down the heat, and there was only a very small window that could open. When we returned back to the hotel on the second night we found that reception was empty and the front door left unlocked. Surely that is a serious security problem. Also no-one stopped us at any point to check if we were actually residents in the hotel. On our last night, they neglected to put in a bath mat - we tried phoning down to reception every 5 minutes or so for more than half an hour, but no-one answered. We had discovered a sweets wrapper on one side of the bed, which wasn't removed at all during our stay. Another point to make is that they still use extremeley scratchy blankets to make up the beds - come on people! If you're going to make up the beds with blankets, at least use a better quality! We wanted to complain at the end of our stay - yet again there was no-one around. Checkout was rushed - gave our room number, then we were told "everything was fine", and the receptionist (same one who checked us in) turned to the next guest. They also advertise a business centre on their website - this consists of a computer and printer set up in the middle of the reception area. You wouldn't dare use it, as everyone is able to see on the screen. We could have accepted all of this as we now realise that it is a budget hotel however the hotels website is extremely misleading and I quote: "Our aim is to provide the highest standards of service and hospitality, with the comfort and facilities you would expect of a modern luxury hotel, while preserving the traditional character of the property itself. You can be sure of a warm and friendly welcome at the Queens Park Hotel" The hotel in my opinion doesn't adhere to anyone of these things and I can honestly say that when I go to London again I would rather pay extra and maybe stay with a reputable group. Ons thing that was a HUGE plus during our stay: Izakaya Hi Sushi in Katherine Street makes the best sushi we have ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok for a couple of nights but no more.”
Reviews.Author: Louly46
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Queens Park Hotel in January for two nights as me and my friend booked 'we will rock you' tickets as a cheap package deal with the hotel. It was very handy to have a the tube so close (2 minute walk) However, It would not be my first choice for a hotel in London! When we got in to the room at 10am and pulled back the curtains there was a blonde clump of hair and a red lighter. I then went on to find a fake nail on the bathroom floor and cloudy tap water when I tried to brush my teeth. When booking the hotel my friend requested a 'quiet room', we didnt really know what that would entail but we didnt what to be kept up all night with disturbances so we went for that opition. they placed us in a room next to the boiler room one side and inside building work the other, the builders of which started at banging at 07.45 both days. The breakfast time was from 8-10. There is no way enough space for 30 people in the dining room at the same time, let alone the maximum of 100 rooms in the hotel. Some groups of people had to eat either in their rooms or out on the few lobby table and chairs next to the front door. The bread was stale and the staff found it hard to cope with the number of people at breakfast time. My London experience was not ruined as the show was amazing and we did a bit of shopping and sight seeing so I would love to go again tomorrow but just not at the same hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: nurseclaire01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a theatre break booked through a seperate company. Although the staff on reception were polite and helpful this was all forgotten once we arrived in the VERY TINY room. This was situated in the basement, next to the conference room. This seriously needed redecorating and was kitted out with batterd and scratched IKEA furniture. The walls were covered in scuff marks and the window latch was broken causing a constant draft throughout the night. The curtains were hanging off the rail and the TV did not have a remote control. I was assured by the reception staff that someone from maintenance would be down to look at the window and curtains, but they didn't materialise. However, despite the disgusting state of the room, the hotel is in an excellent location and very close to 2 tube stations. Generally, the hotel needs a good refurbishment. We were also told on check in the breakfast was served until 11am. Yet upon getting to the dining area at 10.15 we were very rudely told that they had stopped serving 15 mins previously. When I asked whether I could have a small bowl of cornflakes (which they had not yet cleared away), the woman huffed, scowled and told me to 'get my own bowl' then flounced off. For these reasons, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. You are better off staying in a travelodge for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: cuteicecube
Reviews.Content: Accomodation was really basic (the hotel reminds me of a university dorm) but for the less than 50 pound rate that we got (breakfast included!), it was un-beatable value for the money. Room was small but clean and hot water didn't really exist (it was lukewarm). Location was excellent, close to 2 tube stations and 15 minutes walking from the Paddington station. Tons of cheap restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, scary rooms”
Reviews.Author: LDarling87
Reviews.Content: I took my parents to London in 2008 and booked this hotel due to its nice location half a block from Hyde Park and a couple blocks from the tube. The lobby looked nice but omg, once we got to the room we were horrified. There were white stains on the carpet (don't even ask me where I think that came from) and a rusty-colored stain on one of the sheets (blood?). The beds were seriously a joke...I felt each and every spring I couldn't believe the poor bed was still in use! Must've been as old as the hotel was. I would rather have slept on the floor, but the stains.... There were broken things here and there like the toilet paper dispenser which was not a big problem since you don't really need it, but nevertheless annoying because you'd think hotels would maintain their rooms a bit. However, I do have to say that the staff was really wonderful, hence the 5 stars for service. They were nice, brought up lots of towels when we asked for them and conversed with my dad for a while as though they were long-time friends. They also helped give us advice on where we should go, what tube stop would be closest, etc. Breakfast is also included which consists of toast, cereal, coffee, juice and some pastries. The service was actually really great cuz even during the help yourself type of breakfast, right when you chose a table they heated up toast and brought it right to you piping hot. I thought that was really thoughtful. All-in-all, fantastic location. It all would've been nice if I wasn't so grossed out by stains and if I didn't really need sleep (you won't get any on those beds)!

Reviews.Title: “tiny, broken and just naf!”
Reviews.Author: katezisthesex
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to two bus stops that go to victoria station and one that goes into picadilly circus!.. and a tube station close by!.. Room was tiny!.. you had to sit on the toilet on ur side!.. Shower cold; breakfast menu - limited. found that the doors were a bit unstable.. can hear people snoring while you try to sleep!!! and hear people walking about - very noisy!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JAN96
Reviews.Content: although trip was good value we had items taken out of our room so please be careful what you leave in the room there are light finger people about

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: Jonesy2707
Reviews.Content: Don't expect any fancy frills with this hotel, the rooms are very small but clean and you can hear all the goings on outside and if it is windy expect the curtains to blow even with the windows closed. The reception staff are very friendly and will do there best to help but as for the rest they can be quite rude. breakfast is very poor, there are bread rolls with only jam to go in it and cereal thats about it. However it is very well located and if you are only planning to sleep there and not spend any time there it is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - does not deserve the terrible reviews!”
Reviews.Author: MissLMidlands
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package theatre break, mainly because it was a bargain price for B&B and theatre ticket. After then researching the hotel, and reading the reviews posted on this website, I was beginning to dread what we would find, but resigned myself to the fact that it would just be a place to â€˜rest out headsâ€™, and as long as the room was clean, for this price we paid, we would suffer it! I donâ€™t know what other reviewers expectations of budget hotels are, but I couldnâ€™t have been more pleased with our findings. On arrival the reception desk were very helpful, and provided information regarding the surrounding area (we wanted to know which tube station was nearest â€“ opted for Queensway as this was on the Central Line, 5mins walk from the hotel). We stayed in room 306 on the third floor which was a twin room. Yes the room was small, but you are in the centre of London in a budget hotel, but it had all the amenities that you would expect (tea/coffee, tv, hairdryer etc). The bathroom was also more than adequate, good sized, and a decent shower. Both rooms were very clean and presentable. The only minor faults with the room were that the back of the toilet seat had come off, and the sink tap was loose â€“ but by no means does this mean I would mark the hotel as â€˜terribleâ€™! In other reviews there have been comments about noise from the street, but we slept with the window open (the room was quite warm even though no heating was on), and we could hear no street noise at all from the rear of the hotel (we were facing onto the gardens for the road behind). I would suggest that if this is a concern, to request one of these rooms, even though the road that the hotel is on didnâ€™t seem to be busy when we were arriving and leaving the hotel. Breakfast was a little chaotic, but we were seated straight away and there was plenty to eat. Would have been nice to have a little bit of table service (ie. someone to bring you toast or a pot of tea), but it was fine, and was basically just your â€˜bog standardâ€™ continental style breakfast. I will definitely use this hotel again for a theatre break, and would recommend if your expectations of a 3 star hotel were not over inflated. For budget accommodation, this was ideal!

Reviews.Title: “OK for somewhere to sleep while you explore.”
Reviews.Author: Isi1975
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near to the Bayswater Underground Line, which means it is great for being able to explore London. However, the rooms are very small, as are the lifts, so if like me you don't like small spaces, it's not for you. If you're hoping to spend time actually in the hotel, then again, I wouldn't recommend it. In relation to the Breakfast, it's a very basic continental affair - toast, cornflakes/rice crispies, criossant and tinned fruit with juice and coffee - but it fills the gap. There is a concierge who will give you information on seeing London, and there are several restaurants and shops nearby for evening meals if needs be.

Reviews.Title: “out dated faded and spring sprang thu mattress”
Reviews.Author: samsgramboston
Reviews.Content: very outdated hotel good service at desk- very small hot room , very small lift - very narrow halls. cold breakfast- clean food service area. great location to sight see form. A coat of paint and some wallpaper- would do a world of good new bathroom although small.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and somewhat shabby but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Craig1966
Reviews.Content: Hotel has seen better days and foyer has the clutter of a hostel. Room was reasonable and clean but quite a bit of noise from the street. Staff were civil but could not be described as helpful. Breakfast was poor; make your own toast, tinned grapefruit, reconstituted orange juice etc. I paid about Â£25 pppn and as such was ok for this price but so are many others, more centrally located and with little extras such as free wifi and more than 4 channels on portable tv. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tatty”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowLindsay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and we hardly spent any time in the hotel which was a good thing. It is close to Hyde Park, underground and bus routes including the tour buses. It is in serious need of some decoration and updating as it is tired and tatty. The room was really small and the en suite even smaller. The breakfast was just about okay. Some of the staff were quite friendly and others not so much. The location is definitely its best quality.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveller09
Reviews.Content: I agree with those who wonder where all the poor reviews come from. Yes, the public rooms could use redecorating and the rooms are small, but we had a very good stay in an excellent location. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was remodelled and the neighborhood was quiet. We're definitely coming back on our next vist to London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting London- rooms small tho”
Reviews.Author: Nay_1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for visiting London. It is in zone 1 for the tube so tickets are cheap! Easy to get to, great value, go on the internet to get a good rate! Our room was a triple room and it was in the basement and small for 3 people, however the bathroom was big. Even though the room was small we were not in there much, only to sleep and shower as we were out and about sight seeing in London. The breakfast was basic but ok if your just want a cuppa and toast to get ya started. We arrived before the check in time but we were able to store our luggage which was great so we went straight out round the city. I would return but not for a lengthly stay as room was small !!

Reviews.Title: “You'd be better off in a tent in Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: Fats75
Reviews.Content: I normally stay in small, basic, budget hotels in Europe and really don't have very high expectations. I am always pretty happy with the standard of the rooms and service. This would have to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The basic attention to detail and care just wasn't there. The fire alarm went off at 3am in the morning and the staff didn't seem at all concerned. I feared for my life.

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSasa
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and I'm not picky when it comes to hotels, but this place was probably one of my worst hotel experience. I stayed there in 2 different rooms, one facing the front street was small and ok. The second room I stayed was facing the back street, bigger but nasty. The carpet and the bed were just so old and scary. I felt itchy the whole night. I'm used to talk on carpet without shoes, but there I was scared to walk around without shoes. The bed was just too old and so uncomfortable. Breakfast was the worst compare to all my other stays in Europe, just some bread and can fruits. Location wise it's pretty nice, very close walk to subway station, park and lots of shopping and food around, yet it's on a very quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Try the hostels close by”
Reviews.Author: Becky41
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights. When we first arrived we were handed our key and we went in search of the room which was on a mezzanine level on the first floor. It was a bit grubby and in need of a good clean and the decoration was tatty to say the least but the bathroom was clean and as we were only there for 2 nights decided it would be ok. That was until that night when we got back to the room and got into the twin beds. You could feel every spring in the bed. it was rock hard and smelt fusty, and the pillow was flat. I tried unsuccessfully to get comfortable and in the end decided that I would ask for a move to another room. "There were no spare rooms", "there were not staff to move us", "the hotel was full", " try in the morning". These were the reasons we could not have another room. We were given a mattress protector (which smelled fusty) and I asked for 2 more pillows. We were given 1 (thats all they had!!!!!) without a pillow case on and it was stained and smelly. I was told to put it under my existing pillow. I didn't sleep at all and in the morning my back and neck were killing me from the springs in the bed! At reception, I was told by the duty manager (who didnt even look up from his paperwork) that they were full and he was unable to help me. This was a blatant lie as the maids were cleaning numerous rooms and large numbers of people were checking out at the time. I eventualy asked again (this time a young lady who was very helpful) if we could be moved, and the young lady went to plead our case (thats how it felt) with the duty manager, who incidentally didnt come out of the office. After much persuasion on her part he agreed we could have another room on the third floor. So much better - small, but clean and with a comfy bed. Without the young lady virtually begging for us to be moved I fear we would have had to stay in the original room as he could clearly be heard by us as he was saying to the girl, "just tell them we cant help them - we are full". My daughter has travelled the world and has said that hostel accommodation in some of the countries she has travelled to was better than this hotel. The bed was like sleeping on a bag of rocks and fusty smelling beds are not what I expect in any hotel let alone a british 3 star!! My advice is, if you are staying here, check your room, especially the bed, before you part with your cash and dont bother with the breakfast on offer - try one of the many local places serving breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Yungmarie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Got in early but they kept my bags until check in time, which was 2pm. It is very convenient to 2 underground stations among other things, such as an internet cafe, a pub and parks including a 5-7 walk to Notting Hill Gate. All in all, they were good. I didn't need much of anything to run to the reception, but they were efficient enough in the times that I had to go to them. The guy at the concierge desk was very friendly, not much I can say for the receptionist, but it was a very comfortable place to stay. Again everything is small, so the elevators/lifts can only hold no more than 2 people or small children :-) Breakfast was the general, coffee,tea,juice,cereal,croissants and bread with either butter, jam, jelly

Reviews.Title: “queens park hotel, 48 queensborough terrace, bayswater, london w2”
Reviews.Author: michael039
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend with friends never again! Upon arrival there were four guests at the reception voicing loud complaints about their rooms. We arrived at 11am and were told we could not check in till two 'o' clock. Eventually when we did check in we were given room 108, which was absolutely filthy. The wallaper was peeling off the walls, ceiling was black with damp, filthy curtains, carpet, and dirty blankets on the bed! The bathroom had been cleaned though, but the overpowering smell of bleach made our eyes water. The bath was ancient, and was so high I nearly needed a forklift truck to get into it. No plugs for the bath or handbasin, so no choices, had to use the stoneage shower which was over the bath and kept falling off the wall! Upon complaining to reception staff we were moved to room 103 which was only about 1% better. Continental breakfast consisted of brown or white soggy toast, the cheapest brand cornflakes or rice crispies, and tinned fruit. The piece de resistance was the rude, brusque, noisy, and utterly unsociable breakfast staff! Be warned, never, ever stay at this "hotel", a term I would use very loosely, wormwood scrubs would be cleaner, and the prison warders probably more friendly! Dont know how this dump was ever awarded three stars.

Reviews.Title: “cheap & cheerful”
Reviews.Author: nbsfc
Reviews.Content: They say in this world you get what you pay for, well this hotel typifies this, as a last minute break we booked up this hotel to fit with our budget. you get exactly what it says on the brochure, clean, tidy & cheerful, please don't expect the ritz treatment in what really is a 2* hotel, that is my take on it. would I stay there again, yes, but only when booking last minute cheapy.......

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: JayCroydon
Reviews.Content: We had a newly refurbished room on the 3rd floor - very clean, comfortable and quiet. Very basic hotel, but good location, staff were polite and we had very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, and EXTREMELY Convenient, but no frills”
Reviews.Author: annikalibby
Reviews.Content: I was so nervous after reading the reviews on this site, I actually considered cancelling but at such a late time I couldn't find anything remotely similar in price. My fears were quickly reduced after checking in. The room was small (similar to cruise cabins I've stayed in), but the bed was moderately comfortable (not luxurious, but not uncomfortable at all) the bathroom was spotless--I'd be lucky if my own bathroom at home looked like that all the time. Staff was friendly and helpful with all things I needed, even went out of their way to help me make overseas calls and use the in room safe. The tube stations were a quick (less than five minute) walk away and led to three different lines, so the location could not be beat, especially since Hyde Park and the Round Pond, Kensington Palace, etc are also a short walk away. Food shops line Queensway, so that is also easy. I would, however, call this a budget hotel, so here are the downsides: the breakfast area is small, and it does get crowded. Only on weekends did I have to wait for a table though. There are two lifts, and one is tiny (four square feet) and unfortunately during my ten day stay the larger lift was broken the entire time. There is also no air con, so don't be surprised by the amount of street traffic noise that filters in through the open windows. Now here is my only big complaint, and honestly, the hotel has no control over it. I will stay again at this hotel, but I will only do so if I can get a room facing away from Queensborough Terrace because this hotel has the unfortunate location of being right across from a yough hostel that allows its young (often drunk) guests to sit on the terrace (right under your open window) and scream, sing, shout, argue, etc until 3am. Several young men would sing drinking songs in Polish (I speak it roughly) and then for seemingly no reason stop mid sentence and scream obscenities in English. I recognized these voices after a few nights and was glad when they disappeared on the fifth night. I bought foam ear plugs and that helped tremendously, but sadly they were rudely and inconsiderately loud every single night. Again, that was my largest issue during my hotel stay, so all in all I considered it a great find as far as budget friendly and fabulous location, and I'd imagine it's less of a problem in the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “EEEEK!”
Reviews.Author: RonNorfolkUK
Reviews.Content: Maybe i'm geting old but I did not enjoy this place! The other half booked in the day before and they had double booked so he was given what i can only call the staff room / bed store in the basement! he didn't complain (i would have hit the roof!) four beds cramped in to a room no space for moving ok for a stag night i suppose But not happy but i did sleep well! I stayed the next night in Epping SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO much nicer hotel and breakfast was help yerself if you can find a table spare! basic beyond belief!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but clean in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GemmaNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money and it was busy everday of our 4 day stay so I'm not the only one to think this. Our room was tiny but there is so much to do in London that we were barely in the room at all, however it was very clean and even had a tv for catching up on the weather reports. The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from the nearest tube and the bus was 2 mins outside the door and took you straight into Picadilly Circus and Oxford Street. The hotel is just across the road from Kensington Park great for an early morning stroll. The only downside we found about the hotel was that most of the staff were foreign and didn't have a lot of local knowledge to advise us on buses, sightseeing, etc but we managed to figure things out by ourselves ok.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - cheap but miserable hotel”
Reviews.Author: HannahJW
Reviews.Content: It was a couple of years since we stayed here, but seemingly from the other reviews this hotel is still as bad as it was. The room we stayed in was old, tatty and unattractive. The whole room just felt grubby and dingy. The shower room was awful - peeling wallpaper and damp walls. The breakfast was awful - you had to go down into the dining room and help yourself from the meagre selection of white bread and jam and cheap ham and cheese. You had to queue to use the one toaster and when the few plates on the side had gone and we stuck our head in the kitchen to ask for another, the girl grumpily pointed to the just washed ones on the side of the sink and made us dry them ourselves! After the first day we preferred to eat breakfast in a cafe. I know this hotel is cheap, but it was so miserable staying there. I am sure there us better at this price in London - the handy location of this in no way makes up for the standard of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The lousiest hotel I ever stayed in London”
Reviews.Author: MGHBrussels
Reviews.Content: This is the lousiest hotel I ever stayed in London! Durty, noisy, rooms are small you can hardly move when two persons are in it, doors are slammings, beds are with springs which enter into your body at night, bedsheets are durty not talking about the blankets! You can hear your neighboor snooring or can follow his TV programme... Moreover, you have to pay after staying 3 nights in the hotel for them to keep your luggages into a safe place! Really the worst of the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Its not as bad as it looks”
Reviews.Author: threaterlover
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were efficient and booking in went very smoothly. I stayed in room 111 and yes the room is small and stuffy with bars on the window but the room was clean and well presented. The bathroom and shower cubicle were small, especially if you are a big gent but I found the bathroom presentable and adequate. I read the previous rewiews and I nearly cancelled this hotel and booked another one for my threater break but ITS NOT THAT BAD My only negative comment is no bar and they can't make tea!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: rescue_7
Reviews.Content: We booked mid week superbreak for 3 nights. We were not expecting too much from this hotel after reading the reviews but we were very happy with everything. Clean beds ,clean bathroom towels etc. If your very picky under the beds could have been hoovered better. Breakfast, you just grab a table and help yourself to the usual coffee ,tea, tinned fruit, cereal, toast and croisant. Breakfast staff not interactive at all. We were an floors 1 and 2 so used the stairs and think we were lucky to have quiet neighbours or none at all. Over all good location, comfortable if small rooms and would certainly book again. Reception staff helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Supine
Reviews.Content: I am very glad I didn't read the previous reviews before visiting this hotel. A friend and I were booked in on a mid-week Superbreak visit so had no choice of hotel. The hotel was very conveniently situated, easy walking distance from Queensway Tube Station and although we were a bit worried about roadworks being carried on along the length of Queensborough Terrace (replacing water mains) and scaffolding around a nearby residence, we heard absolutely no noise from either of these until nearly 9am. The hotel is also within walking distance of Kensington Gardens, the Serpentine and Hyde Park and an easy bus ride (you can use your Oyster card on the buses) from Marble Arch and Oxford Street. Queensway Tube Station is convenient to link to most London tourist areas and there are some reasonable restaurants and cafes on Queensway. We found the staff friendly and helpful, we were able to leave our cases with the concierge (they were locked in a small room in reception) free of charge, even after checkout we were only charged Â£1 per case which was convenient as we were able to spend the day sightseeing without having to take our cases with us. We were in a basement room which was adequate for our needs and appropriate to what we paid for the trip. There were 'wood' floors which I much prefer to soiled carpet, the bed linen and towels were clean, the bathroom was small but clean (no grimey grouting), there were soaps, shower caps, shampoo etc provided and the shower was good. On the down side, we couldn't get the security safe to open, the curtains did not fully cover the windows and there were no T-bags, only coffee. We may have been lucky regarding lack of night-time noise as we only heard one door slam and one bang from above (reception area) and the hotel may be noisier at weekends but we managed to sleep, unusual in an hotel, until 8.40 am! I would imagine that perhaps the hotel has been improved since previous reviews to comply with Superbreak requirements (I don't know if it works like that ...?) but we would use it again due to the superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews; so true.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVirginia
Reviews.Content: We were in London for six days and this hotel was the only bad thing about the entire trip. We stayed out as late as we can so we won't have to deal much with the hotel room. We stayed on the 4th floor. There are two lifts/elevators, one can fit two people with small luggage and the other lift is a lot smaller. We took the stairs most of the time because the lift runs very slow. The elevator carpeting needs to be replaced, it was very dirty. The carpeting in the entire floor and rooms need to be replaced as well. We can hear the noise from the hallway and every time someone walked by, we can hear the hallway floor creak; the floor in our room creaks as well. The room we were given was very tiny, we can barely move about. We had to take turns getting ready in the mornings. There were holes around the light fixture on the ceiling, stains on the wall, chipped off crown molding and the worse part was the bathroom. We had 20 inch suitcases and had they been bigger, we would not have been able to fit both in the room. The bathroom had two bath towels, one hung on the shower door and the other was on the floor beside the toilet, it was stained, yuck! Thankfully we brought our own towels. There was no toilet paper holder, the shower didn't drain well and the shower head had 6 holes and there was no way to attach it to the shower head so we had to hold it while showering, the worst shower experience ever!!! The only godd thing was we had water pressure. The water leaked through the shower walls and onto the bathroom floor. The door to the bathroom is spring loaded so you can't leave it open because it shuts on its own. There was no air conditioning and one of the windows didn't shut all the way. We would never recommend this hotel to anyone! If you are booking through go-today travel, please do not book this hotel. The only good thing is it's close to the Queensway tube stop. One last thing, I left the "do not disturb" sign on the door the entire time we were there but on our last day, they went in and cleaned the room anyway, and took the sign off!!!, unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is dangerous STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gseire123
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for a flying visit of 2 nights. We stayed 1 and that was only because we couldnt find another hotel we could afford during our first nights stay on short notice. It takes a while to get to the hotel as its a walk from the Bayswater stop on the Underground .We arrived at the hotel early and asked if we could check in - they said no so we asked could we drop our bags. "Sure you can sir its Â£5 a bag" Rediculous. So off we went to sight see e.t.c when we returned we were given a room in the basement of the hotel - it had 2 windows so dirty we could hardly see out of them. They were around 10 inchs long and at the very top of the wall - similar to a prison cell. The radiator was mounted on a piece of wood on the wall - which fell down the morning we checked out. The toilet had excrement stains on the bottom of it, the sink plug hole was half blocked so that the water filled the bath during a shower and took 10 minutes to empty. The shower curtain was mouldy - black and green. The bed+clothes where torn and old. The wall paper was peeling and the carpet ripped. There were stains every where. After my girlfriend had been struck by the radiator on the wall we had enough. I spoke to the lady on the front desk who was not a proper memeber of staff but rather a backpacker who worked weekends in the hotel to pay for her room. She was actually very nice and she came to our room to verify what we were complaining about. There was no person in the hotel on Saturday or Sunday that could authorise an early check out. I argued with the "Manager" on the phone for over 25 minutes explaining that I expected a full refund given the disgraceful room we had receieved that the harm caused to my girlfriend. He insisted that the room was fine and that we would be charged an early check out charge. We spent hours of our second day looking for another hotel we could stay and traveling to it. This hotel ruined our trip and was DISGUSTING! If you read any other reviews I have written on other hotels in the same price range as this you will see that we are not easily annoyed by hotel nor put off by locations. This hotel is a health hazard and should be closed. Please do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Highland02
Reviews.Content: Basement room very small and in desparate need of redecoation. Reception staff were friendly but not so the dining room staff. On our last day at breakfast, the chief walked through from the kitchen area in a filthy white jacket. Not what you want to see! Location was good though for the tube and a good choice of local restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Room Burglarized”
Reviews.Author: Girino1
Reviews.Content: I was to stay there from July 21st to July 28th. And I would. Until I found out that someone had broked into mine and other 4 rooms on Saturday afternoon. After a regular stay, with no bad or good surprises - the room was tiny and a bit hot, but clean enough; the common areas were pretty narrow and in need of refurbishment, not to mention the elevators; the breakfast was tedious, with much of the same thing, and the clerk service limited, but would do -, I became stupefied when I got back from a typical full tourist day at 11:20 p.m. and found the door unlocked and loose - the rest from this point on would be totally predictable: wood and iron pieces of the door and from the door frame all spread on the carpet, my suitcase open an torn (they opened it with a knife or something similar) and all my clothes and personal belongings turned over. I was using the safety box inside the closet (the closet was unlocked but nothing there was touched) but, still, had 200 euros inside a bag kept in the suitcase, but miraculously they did not see it or took it! (they were too busy and had much to do in the room in front of mine: I looked back and found it with the door totally destroyed and detached from its frame (it was laid on the ground!) and they also had other neighboursÂ´ rooms to break into. On the other hand, they took away my watch I was fond of and some money from the German guy beside; he was not using a suitcase locker, differently from me (though it was useless). The clerk claimed that they did not take anything else from the others, that I was the only one robbed. They were looking for things with presumable value that would fit in a pocket . The hotel has no security at all and since in my week stay there wasnÂ´t a single day when someone from the desk asked me where I was going before entering or leaving the hotel. It was very frustrating to see that, besides the Portuguese guy on the desk during the night shift, who gave the minimal support and called the police, the manager was absent and unhelpful, since took two days to authorize the 20 pounds refund for the new ordinary suitcase I had to buy and to allow my second night in the hotel in front of the Queens Park they booked me into - he wanted me to come back and stay my last night in London in that total unsafe place, which I refused. For my watch I got only more 20 pounds. I talked to three different police officers, only the last one was understanding, but they were unanimous in saying that nothing else could be done, that they had already been there for some poor investigation they did (they wasnÂ´t even aware that my room was also burglarized, they thought that the thiefs broke into only 3 rooms and took notice that there were 2 more rooms by my fone call). Police added it was becoming frequent in the Bayswater region and that in Brazil would be the same (!). The hotel had no cameras or security system at all; there are two doors separating the elevator hall from the alleys, helping any sound to go through. It was very easy for a couple of guys to do what they did: one can be just checking the imminent danger while the other kicks each door he wants, close the curtains and do the service. They new sharply the room service schedule: at 1:00 p.m. I was there and so was the maid. The crime happened afterwards. I strongly recommend to keep away from this poor hotel if do not want to count on the "luck" I had in having only one good stolen. I have photos of the incident, which I have downloaded to this site. The first and best one, with the front view of the smashed door, from the enterer's perspective, was deleated from the camera by accident, but there are still 10 photographs remaining, among which even the most sceptics can find sheer evidences of the episode.

Reviews.Title: “No frills ;-)”
Reviews.Author: RTWUK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute as needed to be in London for just one night, and seeing as the cost of the stay was within my budget decided to go for it. The location is fine for the money and the hotel/room was clean. Was disappointed in the overall standard of the room. It was in dire need of a makeover: scuffed marks on the walls, the bathroom door had a hole in it, no bedside light, matress was worn out and only ONE bedsheet between and the matress itself (shouldn't there be a matress protector or something??). The TV remote didn't work. I didn't complain as was only there for one night so on this occasion the hotel served its purpose... and as they say you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but very clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai2000
Reviews.Content: New carpet, new bed, newly refurbished en suite and extremely clean and shining. The only drawback was that the room size did not allow for wardrobe and clothes hanging space. The breakfast was simple but plentiful. Fantastic value for money in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “This place is absolutly fine”
Reviews.Author: EastbourneTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in feb. When we booked i was nervous at what we would find because of all the bad reviews. But i can honestly say it was fine. We had a double room which was tiny but it was clean with an on-suite. Booking direct through the hotel web-site we only paid Â£40 per night including breakfast. The Breakfast was basic with cereals, croissants, toast, tea, coffee and juice it was all fine. The location was brilliant very close to tube and right next to hyde park. I would definatley stay there again and would recommend it to friends. I think some of the reviews are a bit harsh as its only a 2 star and for Â£40 you can't expect the ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book - worst we've seen .... ever”
Reviews.Author: AK01
Reviews.Content: Having booked a short break for a Birthday, we were excited to arrive in the big smoke. Needless to say our excitment turned to disgust and disappointment from the moment the taxi stopped outside the hotel. My advice would be to stay well away, do not book and definately do not trust their web pages, the photos are clearly of some age. The rooms were dirty, small with drawer fronts missing and the single wardrobe in a triple room would not even close. There was damp staining to the ceilings and walls, mildew to the windows and the bathroom could have kept the most budding scientists busy for weeks. We were offered an alternative, in the basement and uncleaned. The bin hadn't even been empied. If I could rate this 0/5 I would. We booked into the Marriot in Maidavale, which was beautiful and I would recommend to anyone. Friendly, professional and clean with large rooms and comfy beds. PLEASE DO NOT BOOK INTO THIS HOTEL - The Queens Park hotel that is!. I would not leave a rat to die there. They would not refund my first night although there was no way we could stay in this room.

Reviews.Title: “"Look kids--Big Ben! Parliament!"”
Reviews.Author: buddybear1221
Reviews.Content: My husband I traveled to London for our honeymoon. Being newlyweds, we didn't have much money, and we didn't want to spend all of it on the room. We booked the trip through a travel agency, and they actually had us at a different hotel, but had to change the reservation at the last minute. We'd seen pictures of the other place, so we knew what we were in for with that hotel, but there were no pictures of this hotel to prepare us for the shock. The outside of the hotel was beautiful. It was clean and freshly painted, and in a lovely area of town, convenient to the underground and walking distance to several shops. Actually, if you've seen National Lampoon's European Vacation, you've seen the hotel. It's under a different name, and the interior is a set, but it's the hotel that the Griswold's pull up to on the British leg of their tour. Just a bit of useless trivia. We were pleasantly surprised that we were allowed to check in early, and not made to loiter around the lobby for the several hours until the actual check-in time. That was our last bit of good news. We both knew the room would be small, but we're also both the type that can live with pretty much anything as long as the room is clean and there's a private bathroom--which this had, thank goodness. We certainly weren't expecting pillow mints and turn-down service. This room wasn't small. It wasn't tiny. It was miniscule. In order to get dressed in the mornings, one of us had to stand on the bed (generally me, since I'm shorter and my husband kept hitting his head on the ceiling). We had one large bag and two carry-ons, and came very close to having to leave one of the carry-ons in the hall, just to fit in the room. The bed was large and comfortable. The room and bath were clean and nicely decorated. The lights worked when they felt like it--never all at the same time. The bathroom light went out, rendering the room pitch black, and maintenance said they'd get someone up the next day. That I could live with. The toilet stopped flushing, and maintenance said they'd get someone up the next day. That I could NOT live with. We ran out of toilet paper, and maintenance said they'd get some up the next day. COME ON! We constantly had to keep going to the front desk to get things like towels (needed one each), soap, etc. that should have been in the room each day. Two people can not go 5 days on one foil packet of shampoo. When I called down to let them know that the radiator was broken, the front desk employee actually SIGHED. Now, I'm one to look for the humor in situations, and I find it hilarious that on my honeymoon in London, I got three BBC channels, and not one of them carried Doctor Who. They were also all staticy. We did, however, watch Borat on our neighbor's big screen tv by looking out our window into theirs. I guess that's something. The continental breakfast is alright, but nothing to write home about. There are no snack or soda machines, but there is a Tesco grocery around the corner. This hotel will always have a place in my heart because it was where I spent the first few days of my marriage, and I look back on it fondly, but honestly, neither of us want to relive that. We'll go somewhere else next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just shocking...”
Reviews.Author: CoachRoberts
Reviews.Content: I don't want to write too much as I've wasted enough of my time being in, or thinking of this sad excuse for a hotel. I have no idea what star system they work on, but 3* to me seemed to be 3 too many. The first room we were put in was small with wall paper peeling off the wall and a damp towel on the bathroom floor. On being moved to a "better" room, which had a broken bin, no toilet paper and cigarette burns on the net curtains we accepted that we should stay out as long as possible that evening to avoid being in that building. Honestly, to think we managed to stay in Hiltons for ~Â£70 a night to get bumped at this dump upset both me and the girlfriend. Save your money for another month before your stay and just stay somewhere nicer. AVOID! PLEASE!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: roseSouthEastEngland
Reviews.Content: Shocked when we arrived, exterior looked good as in various websites but first room given was so small and dirty, no kettle and socket not fixed to wall properly. Old tatty blankets, totally horrid and not as in photos etc........delapidated to say the least. Lifts are extremely small and paper peeling as well as paint in halls, rooms, reception etc. Second room offered was larger with net curtains half hanging, huge stains on carpet, broken bin and tv remote control, shower door wouldnt shut properly and all very tatty with writing on the wall, paint flaking and very dated......dirty and one looked out to see if cockroaches or fleas would appear. Window in both rooms delapidated and whole hotel appeared dirty and tired, huge clumps of hair balls on stairways. Didnt expect luxury at Â£84.50 per night but did expect it to be clean and tidy and as in the photos. Attended for a business party nearby so returned to room at 1am and left at 6am without daring to eat incase the kitchen reflected the rest of the hotel. Very upset at the misleading details shown on websites regarding this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice”
Reviews.Author: MrsSara
Reviews.Content: I, travelling alone with my 8 and 11 year old daughters, stayed at this hotel for two nights.
