We ended ut in a tripleroom in the basement, with a view of some kind of storage room full of crap (why do they even bother to put a window in the room?) We could hear the underground in our room, but ok we can live with that ;) The room smelled funny when we first got there but we got used to it after a while... There were no bedlights, and being in the basement with no natural light either, in the morning it was a little adventure to walk trought the room to switch on the lamps. The breakfast was very poor, basically coffÃ©e, tea, juice and toast with jam. I have been to London several times and are usually not so picky but this is a place where I would never stay again! The bathroom locked nice thought, but don't touch anything because it will fall down on you ;)

Reviews.Title: “Its ok”
Reviews.Author: HibboLeeds
Reviews.Content: After booking the hotel I came across some mostly unfavourable reviews about this hotel. Seeing as there were 5 of us going to London to stay here, me my partner, child 9 years and 2 parents (60+) I was understandably very concerned for our forthcoming 2 nights stay. Conclusion: Its a budget hotel in a great location to get around London. Cheap n cheerful! Yes, it was a bit tatty and in need of some decoration. Yes, the staff were mostly foreign but were not rude, in our dealings at least. The bedding was clean and not a problem. One morning the hot water was off throughout the hotel, could have been a major issue for this review but it was, as promised, back on for our evening return and what a nice hot shower to have. The breakfast was fine. No bar as mentioned in an earlier review. All in all, if you just want somewhere to sleep and leave your bags all for a cheap price.....Then its fine. You dont go to London to sit in your hotel room, its a good base. If you want the Ritz then get your money out and pay for it.. So the rooms/elevator are small and it seems a bit 'rough around the edges'. Youre paying a small price to stay there compared to other hotels.. Its OK !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Petunia1Greece
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel after contacting them by email. They gave us the rates per room per night in written and we were surprised to know when we arrived that they expected us to understand rates change according to the receptionist and day of the week. Their excuses were so childish. The rooms were so tiny and dirty, no hot water, you could not move, the photos on their site have nothing to do with reality.Breakfast is awful and they serve it in a dirty small room that could be ideal for their staff. Be very carefull to get written confirmation as they will drive you mad! Never in my life has such a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute dump!!”
Reviews.Author: DublinJackeen
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for a weekend. we knew it was a budget hotel before arriving, however, expected some degree of hygiene and cleanliness. the carpets and curtains were filthy. the wallpaper was peeling away from the walls. this was without doubt the worst expeinence I have ever had in any hotel anywhere in the world. the photos on the website do not represent what is on offer. this is not only my view, but that of the other people that accompanied us on our trip. we had three rooms in the hotel for the weekend and all were in the same poor condition -one even has grafitti scrawled on the bedroom walls.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: PramPusher
Reviews.Content: We had been warned about how tiny rooms are in Europe so tht was no surprise but that was not the issue here. The bed was horrible, with absolutely no padding left between you and the springs. The furniture was more in the way and the layout for the room could be much better at least for the room we stayed in which was in the dungeon-like basement. The walls were super thin so the troop of school children that decided to stay next to us one night kept shutting the doors loudly and came in and out all night long. I wanted to give their chaperon a piece of my mind the next morning. The TV which looked fairly new did not work andn seemed possessed since it would turn on for two seconds and the just turn off. There were also two light bulbs that were out which could have helped light up the cell-like area a bit more. Both these issues were brought to the attention of the staff but nothing was ever done. The bathroom is remodeled but the shower does not close all the way and you get everything wet so watch the really high step and make sure you don't slip on all the water everywhere. The day staff was very nice and tried to help. The night shift was cold and rude so we gave up. Breakfast was very average but we were not visiting London for the food we were saving our stomachs for Paris. Over all the only thing this place has going for it is its proximity to the Tube and interesting array of shops and food about two blocks down. Next time we will spend a little extra money at least for a decent bed so I can be more well rested!

Reviews.Title: “Queens Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunderlandgirl_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Queens Park Hotel for one night and to be honest it was one night too many. Our original room the window catch was broken. We were moved to another room but the rooms are tiny and the shower was more of a drip. Certainly no good to wash in. There was major road works going on directly outside the hotel causing a lot of dust and noise but none of this was mentioned when we booked the hotel. The continental breafast was stale, cheap bread which you had to toast yourself or tinned fruit. We ended up sitting in the lobby of the hotel eating what little we could stomach as the tiny dining area was full. Not an enjoyable experience and would certainly never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply not good enough......”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDane007
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 people in two rooms, but saw 3 rooms. The rooms were very, very small, in one room the 2 doors couldn't open because of the bed. Worse were the mattresses: it felt like lying on metal wires, which was excactly what we did - awfull (the staff told us that all beds were the same). My father asked for a lamp and a chair for some evening reading, but was told after asking several times: we don't have chairs in the rooms, it is not hotel policy - funny because there was a chair in the other room... The toilet papir stood on the floor and the shower hose was leaking. Our safe didn't work, the staff figured it was due to a used up battery, but it was never fixed. Breakfast was very uninspiring: two types of marmelade of the cheapest kind, no cheese, no honey, no bacon and eggs, just the same boring tree types of bread, one type of cereal, bad juice, milk, coffee and tea. Not very friendly either, always started removing our plates ect. before we were finished.

Reviews.Title: “Alright Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: joyinlagunahills
Reviews.Content: I got the hotel through Hotwire and was very concerned by some of the reviews here, however, the hotel was fine. It is not a luxury hotel, but was clean, color flat screen tv, bed was fine, telephone, modern private bathroom, nice armoire, very small room but not uncomfortably small, desk, coffee maker, hairdryer. Tiny lift and slightly bigger lift. Breakfast of toast, croissants, rolls, sliced fruit, orange juice, grapefruit juice, 2 kinds of cereal, coffee, milk, tea. (Wish they'd had, even a bowl of plain yogurt for some additional protein). Great location. Get off at the Queesnway tube stop, walk towards Kennsington Gardens, turn left, 2 blocks to Queensborough Terrace. Hotel is on the far side of the street. Very reasonable for a safe place in this great location. Probably Hotwire gives the 1/2 extra star for the location? In this price range your only other choice is out at Heathrow which means spending time and the overpriced tube cost to get in and out of the city everyday. If you want a luxury hotel, this is not the place for you, but for a low cost place from which to see London, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine”
Reviews.Author: OfcMgrCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The room with twin beds was clean and comfortable. Bathroom small but plenty big enough for one at at time. Staff extraordinarily helpful. We got as many towels as we wanted immediately. Sheets were changed twice during our 6 day stay, continental breakfast was fine. Good coffee! The only noise was from the Youth Hostel across the street and they weren't that bad. It is summer after all....It was great to be so near the Park, the Tube (2 stations), lots of restaurants and Whitbeys. After reading so many bad reviews, I too, was prepared to move but I guess people only write letters of complaint, not praise. I don't know what the others expected for the price, but my friend and I felt we had good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay here”
Reviews.Author: w4llaroo
Reviews.Content: Oh my word what a bag of pants Wouldnâ€™t let my pet sheep stay here Donâ€™t stay here even if your life depends on it! Damp all over the bathroom, shower was flooded so I thought I was having a bath 2! Breakfast staff so rude & when I asked about a full English she looked at me funnyQ Room was like a match box! Booked late so was last place with free rooms! Said 4 star but I wouldnâ€™t get a 1 off me! Robert & Lucy From wales where the sheep live

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Bat52CentralOhio
Reviews.Content: A friendly staff that really tries. Rooms are small as is typical for this area of London. You need to bring your own travel alarm as there is no radio/alarm in the room although the wake up service is prompt. I agree the lifts are small, one person and luggage is about it. Continental breakfast is very adequate, you may order up eggs and other hot items at additional cost, if the continental is not included in your rate. Rooms are clean, water pressure is terrific, hot hot water flows and the in room instant coffee is really good.. Despite it having 120 rooms, very quiet hotel as well as the neighborhood. Two blocks from Queensway tube stop (Central red line) and many places to eat nearby. Although lacking a bar, no problem sitting out on the stoop and having a glass of wine or a beer purchased half a block away at the Shell station (very good adequate selection). If you care to go a little more upscale for a cocktail,hotels within couple hundered yards have bars. Only 4 or 6 rooms have air conditioning at additional cost of 10 pounds, but it's London and you rarely need it. Excellent location off of Hyde Park. This is not an upscale hotel, as is typical for this part of London, just a basic clean place to sleep and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed just long enough to book a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: AOlzewski
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel, there was a man complaining about his room already at the reception desk. Then there was a girl complaining. I started to get the picture. I figured it couldn't be that bad, though. All I needed was a clean bed for one night. I was given room B107. First off, I and my luggage almost didn't fit in the tiny, shabby little box of an elevator. It stopped either 6 inches too high or too low for its intended floor, before coming to a jolting stop. The "B" in B107 obviously stood for basement. My room was down a series of hallways with bad lighting and stagnant air. I was travelling solo, and I did not feel safe down there. I finally found the room and went inside. No, no, no. The room was dirty and the plumbing leading away from the toilet was a flexible clothes dryer exhaust tube. You know, the white plastic tubing that should never be used to carry urine and feces anywhere? Yep, that's what they were using for the outflow. I went to the front desk, and told him I needed a clean room that was on a floor with other people around. The next room had what appeared to be legal plumbing, but it was filthy. There was some sort of grease line on the wall just above the bed. The walls were so dirty with chunks of plaster missing, and the ceiling peeling down with mold and water stains. The window only partially closed, and the locking mechanism on the door could not be secured. It looked like someone had chisled the wood away *from the inside*. Acckkk! I called Hotwire long distance on my cell to tell them that I absolutely could not stay there and that it shouldn't even be operating with an illegal plumbing system like that. They were very helpful and very apologetic. I ended up in the Thistle around the corner for only $40 more. The difference was night and day. I wouldn't stay in the Queens Park Hotel if they paid me!

Reviews.Title: “The mouse I saw in the breakfast room gave me a heads up about what was coming..”
Reviews.Author: Beverly_Mars
Reviews.Content: I saw a few photos of other hotel rooms, but I can honestly say that they had nothing to do with my own. Of course we had a private bathroom, but that's it! No clean towels, no clean sheets, no vacuuming and sometimes not even toilet paper... As I first walked into the hotel, I saw a mouse in the breakfast room...no wonder why; the vacuum cleaner remained in the hall, unused during my whole stay (5 nights).I guess a lot of guests must have seen it long before I did... Our key-cards didn't work most of the times and we had to go down all the way to the lobby to have them reprogrammed. Apart from that, lovely neighbourhood, two tube stations nearby and Hyde Park of course. If you don't mind packing your own sheets and towels, then this hotel is all right, I guess..

Reviews.Title: “BIG Dislike!!!”
Reviews.Author: piperjock
Reviews.Content: I've read alot of the reviews and often didn't agree with all the negatives. However, i have been compelled to write a review after staying at this hotel as it was really a disgrace. I don't know how they qaulify as a hotel. We booked 4 rooms to stay in for taking part in the london marathon. My girlfriend and i, my brother and his wife, my mum and dad, and my sister,her boyfriend and son. Our room was tiny, cupboard only a single size, toilet door did not shut, shower didn't hang on, toilet had a bad smell (Not only after I'd been in it!), decor dated, and black marks all over the walls, also banged my head off the tv sticking out the wall. My brothers room was pretty much the same, siters room was nice though and it had air-con. It was like being in a different hotel. Very nice, although they gota cockroach on the last night(3rd night), and mum and dads room was a step up from ours too, but still not great. We arrived late at night on the first night so just wanted to get our heads down there and then. When we complained the following afternoon, we got nothing but excuses from the smarmy little receptionist guy. Full of it and we were getting nowhere. Like I said, i really don't like reading so many bad reviews as there are alot to be said about personal preference/opinion, BUT i really wouldn't advice anyone to stay here. pay the extra Â£20-30 and get somewhere decent. Big thumbs down from everyone in my party...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price; clean and safe, but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: swahionta
Reviews.Content: This place is not bad for the price; getting a decent room in central london for 35 GBP seems next to impossible - but that's exactly what I paid here. The place was clean and safe, although my single room was TINY. Don't expect big size or a nice view. it's a good place to crash for the night but nothing really beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Zach003
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel, this is probably the best advice you can get. The rooms are very small as are the beds. You have to be very much in love to sleep in the so-called double bed. The bathroom was nice except for no hot water in the morning. Breakfast also is ok if you love toast. Some of the staff are very nice and helpfull but a few of them seems to have studied at Fawlty Towers. The hotels only real asset is its prime location close to the tube, busses and restaurants in quuensway but there are lot of better hotels only slightly more expensive in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: cirlu
Reviews.Content: By far our worst hotel experience in London: We booked this hotel after seeing pictures and description at the hotel's own website. The room was very small and so was the bed: Actually the bed was so short that I (1m83cm) had to lie diagonal in order to bee there. No duvets were present, but one bedsheet and blanket for sharing. Amongst others, the hotel webside promised "flat screen LCD television" but it was some 14" old fashion tv with only three channels and no working remote. It also promised a trousers press which were there, but it was visibly broken. Bathroom was also very small and toilet cistern was extremely slow to refill. The continental breakfast did not contain what I would call "a selection" of cereals as stated on the hotel website. It contained of cornflakes and one type of oatmeals or the like. None of the promised fruit or juices were present. We were woken several times as the firealarm - according to the staff when we asked about it - went off everytime someone took a cigarette somewhere at the hotel. Hence we ended up in not taking the alarm seriously. Lifts were of very poor quality and actually we trembled out of the lift the first time as it didn't quite reach the level of one of the floors, but was missing a few inches. The staff didn't greet when guests were coming or going, but seemed rather resigned.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful accommodation in most ways”
Reviews.Author: Merg_8
Reviews.Content: -Dingy small room -Shower leaked, and sprayed water everywher - toilet seat and garbage broken - carpet had "hills"in it from wear - TV busted - Safe didn't work - Surly aweful staff, except for one gentleman (who should be commended -- of black descent) who was exceptional - Charged for services (which was OK) but shorted me on change because, believe it or not, they didn't have any! - needs complete renovation of halls and (at least) my room I could go on, but you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: happyholsScotland
Reviews.Content: first room was small,dirty & had water leaking in from room upstairs . got moved to a 2nd room which was better. our friends also had to change room only to have a Â£300 personal item disappear the next dayfrom his drawer. when the police got involved the item appeared at reception that night ........amazing......wont be back

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinytootz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Thomsons and when we got home, we had a look on the internet for details on it. I find that almost all of the reviews on this hotel are OTT! It is around a 5 min walk from Bayswater tube (circle line) and 7 mins from Queensway tube (central line). Entrance area is clean and easy to understand (in terms of where you check in etc). Lifts are very small, one can fit 4 people in, the other can just about manage 2 (without bags!) but better than no lift at all! Room was an ok size, had a double bed, wardrobe, bed side cabinet and desk with chair. Bathroom was very clean with toilet, shower and basin, bathmat, hand towel and 2 bath towels. Room came with a kettle, tea, coffee, sugar, milk, hairdryer and wall mounted flat screen TV. Room was quiet, well heated with 2 opening windows. Continental breakfast, consisted of cereal (cornflakes and rice krispies), toast (white or brown bread with butter, jam and marmalade), bread rolls, croissants, fruit (looked like tinned grapefruit and tropical mix), coffee, orange juice and mixed fruit juice. All was nice, toasters had a mind of their own! Internet access available, Â£1.50 per 30 mins which is steep, but others in Bayswater only provided wireless access, no actual PC or laptop to work from. Rooms were cleaned daily and restocked with coffee stuff and shampoos etc. Hallways were scruffy looking, wallpaper coming off etc but i wasn't intending on hanging around in the hallways so was of no real importance! I found the staff so-so, we didn't have any problems to report but they didn't pay a lot of attention to us when checking in or out. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, rooms were of 3* standard, breakfast was more than acceptable and the area of Bayswater is a great area! Lots of (free) cash machines, several places to eat (McDonalds, japanese, Pizza Hut, Belle Italia, waffle house, chinese etc) and places to have a drink. Quite a quiet area and only a few stops on the central line from Victoria (VERY handy!) Overall i would give the hotel 8.5/10 and the area of Bayswater 10/10!

Reviews.Title: “What are you people talking about?!?!”
Reviews.Author: MzKittin
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here and was expecting quite the nightmare. What I found was the opposite. I am a single 30 something woman traveling alone to London and what I found was great. I stayed there 8 nights. From Christmas to New Years. I had to pre pay too but thatâ€™s because I went through Go Today, so itâ€™s the same as if I would have paid when I got there. No big deal. Speaking of paying, I thought they were going to charge me for my local incoming phone calls from my friend who I went to visit, they did not. So itâ€™s not like they were trying to tack anything onto my bill. The room was small, sure, but do you expect to hang out in the room when visiting London? It was safe and clean. The bed was a bit lumpy but by the time I got back I was exhausted and had no problem sleeping. The bathroom was clean as was the rest of the room. The staff was amazing too. Breakfast, sure...not much but fresh fruit, cereal and toast are really all I need in the morning. It really filled me up. Quite personally, I think that all the people writing these horrible reviews are just a little pretentious. The place is in a very nice area, but it's just not that kind of hotel. It reminded me of a very nice hostel. If you are a person that really doesnâ€™t care that much about image and status and stuff like that, just want a clean, affordable place to lay your head, in a great area. I would recommend Queens Park. Both I and my friend agreed itâ€™s really not a bad place at all. We did get a good giggle about the liftsâ€¦.they are very tiny, so donâ€™t take too huge of a bag, but if you do Iâ€™m sure the guys at the front desk would be more than willing to take them up for you. I found it very quaint and I would stay there again. I have attached a pic of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy flophouse”
Reviews.Author: deid
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for two friends and myself for a special birthday weekend away. We chose the hotel on the basis of the website photos and it's central location. On arrival payment was taken in advance. The room we were shown to was filthy, in the basement, with little natural light, and exceptionally small for a triple room. We complained and were shown two other basement rooms in a similar filthy condition including one onto the street with no curtains on the window and an unsatisfactory fourth floor room. The 'Hotel' is considerably run down from the impression given by the website. The manager declined to refund our money in full (retained the cost of one night for each of us) when we decided not to stay even one night, saying we could complain if we liked but it would make no difference as all complaints went to him anyway. We felt quite unsafe. Definitely not a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless in London”
Reviews.Author: natashabebe
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and decided to take a chance. It was difficult to get three single beds (for three adults) in one room on relatively short notice. Location was great, and we did feel safe in our room, but that was the best I can say. There was a cigarette burn hole in my bedspread. I tried not to look too closely at my surroundings. I noticed the crude repairs done in the bathroom to repair the broken door and shower curtain rod. The refrigerator was feeble and worthless. But the worst, and the real downside, was an inability to get a decent rest. The beds were all "broken" and sagged in the middle, making restful sleep impossible. We averaged about four hours tops, mostly from exhaustion. The room was hot and stuffy with the window closed, but the noise from the street was awful with the window open. It sounded like there was a pub across the street, and I woke one night to repeated peels of a woman's laughter. Traffic noise I'm used to, and still it was bad. The included breakfast was worthless. No fruit either fresh or canned. Mostly breads, or dry cereal served with room-temperature milk. And last, English did not seem to be the native language of either the staff or most of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best you'll find...”
Reviews.Author: D0kt0rb
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges a lot of money because of its location....but it really is not worth the cost. As past reviewers have noted, there is a lot to be wary about, and although I found it alright for a short stay, I know there are better options out there. The lifts were coffin cramped and slow, so I negoiated the badly labelled staircases, wandering around steps and floors until I got to my room. The room itself was very good - a bit cramped but I am on my own so it wasn't that bad. The bathroom had not been cleaned that well, and it was very small. "Breakfast" really did live up to the name "fast" - the bread/fruit/cereal selection would have been a scandal were it not so laughable. Saying all this, I really would not bad mouth the hotel too much - it is great for three tube lines, and almost every bus is on the main route into Oxford Street or Westminster. It is a good location for the shopping and pubs outside Queensway station itself.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Ty_wales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dirty, from the front door to inside your room. We had to chance rooms three times because the standard was so poor. I wasn't expecting 5 star but was expecting 3 star I would only give it 1. On the bright side the staff are friendly and do try to make things right, but you can't make a silk purse out of a sow's ear. There are much better hotel's in the same price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: FergalPoole
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is nothing like their website pretends. It is a cheap, tacky and dirty hotel well past its sell by date. One nite in a grubby rubbish room with a bed like a board was the worst Â£110 I have ever spent. The hotel would be better assigned to vagrants.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel - even if it is cheap!”
Reviews.Author: earlsferrygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a work trip and would never do so again. The rooms were very tatty and in need of decoration. The floors were uneven and i didn't want to take off my shoes and walk on the carpet. The shower was in barely working order and the TV was worse than useless. Worst thing though was that the fire exit on the fourth floor was mostly blocked by matress and furniture from a room that was being refurbished. We reported this to reception and it was duly noted but remained unchanged when we left the next day. Staff were pleasant and tried to be helpful but they are working with very poor facilities. Lots of foreign tourists were staying and i felt quite ashamed at the standard of accommodation they were being offered for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Queens Park Hotel London a real nightmare.!!!”
Reviews.Author: kris1959
Reviews.Content: Queens Park Hotel, London 48 Queensborough Terrace, Bayswater, London A real nightmare.!!! This hotel NEEDS DECORATING. Dirty rooms. Window whoch opened max 6 inches. Bedroom: Thin pillow & very terrible beds, hard and very lumpy broken bed. Curtains were so old and dirty. Poor standard and wall paper and borders was peeling off. Beaten up lampshade. Bedrooms are shabby and carpet dampish smell. The bathroom was tiny. Hair dryer broken. The halls were narrow and hard to navigate. Very noisy from early in the morning by staff in reception. Very small breakfast. Cornflakes and soggy toast with jam, coffee/tea and juice and fruit cocktail. No cheese or egg. VERY basic â€œContinental Breakfastâ€�. No facilities to buy food. Confirmation promised a daily paper - receptionist informed me this has been discontinued for the past three years! Would strongly recommend people do NOT stay there In my experience, this is no way a 3-star hotel Hotel a real nightmare. !!! These observations refer to rooms 108 and 120 when we would be moved for the second night. Not value for money at all!!

Reviews.Title: “condemned to helll !!”
Reviews.Author: cassey7999
Reviews.Content: me and my partner booked this hotel from the londonhotelsite.com website, after reading it was a 3 star hotel,and described as being a 'luxury hotel' with 'comfort' and having 'high standards' and being 'hospitable' these are the most untrue claims that this hotel can make, when we first arrived we were given a room on the first floor which we used the 'coffin' like lifts to get to that floor, after walking down a dark stinking coridor we finaly got to our room, which was the size of a hamster cage ! we told the reception that we could not stay there, we were then given another room to look at on the 5th floor, me and my partner had to take 2 sepertae journeys in the lift to get the to that floor, they are so tiny !! we arrived on the 5th floor which had no lights switched on in the coridors, and old used mattress were stored right infront of the lifts, we had to find the light switches, then we had the same problem the room was not acceptable, we told the reception that we want a better room on the ground floor as we dont find the lifts acceptable or even safe. we were given a ground floor room, which stunk like urine ! the carpet was dispicable,and not even vacuumed properly, the wallpaper was hanging off the walls, with think green mould caused by damp, the radiators were clogged thick with dust and dirt, the walls and skirting board were covered in unknown liquid type stains, and dust and dirt, the trouser press fell away completely from the wall, which is unsafe. the bathroom was full of damp and rotten bath panels, and the tiles were full of resdue from previous guests taking showers. one morning the cleaner turned up to clean our room carrying a dirty hand held bucket and a dirty brown stained sponge !! not a proffesional cleaning maids trolly insight. despite there own fire safety procedures (which is found on the back of the room door) stateing that every day at 12 noon they will test the fire alarm, we stayed there for 3 days and never heard it once,....maybe it dosent work at all ??!!...potentially an extreme fire safety hazard ! we were constantly harrassed by the receptionist staff requesting we change the room, as they had over booked that room for another guest ! the mattress was completely worn out, it was ripped and had the springs sprung, most unbeliveably it was covered all over in heavey yellow and brown stains,... this hotel is no where near a 3 star !!!! and the comments on there own website are very misleading we have filmed all this evidence. just because the room rate was not as expensive as other hotels, it does not mean we have to accept an inferior service or less standards of good housekeeping. my advice would be to stay away completely, it is the most unhygienic place i have ever had the misfortune to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: LenanVictor
Reviews.Content: We (young married couple) stayed at Queens Park Hotel for 3 nights August 10-13 2007. We got dbl room on the basement floor. It was great, because we didn't need to use an elevator at all and the room wasn't hot at all, although it was August. The room is small, but VERY clean, the bathroom is VERY clean, which is the first pripority for me. There is a bath, 4 towels - 2 small & 2 big, change towels EVERY DAY. There is a private safe in the room, as well as tea & coffee faciities. The breakfast was poor, but it was enough for me for 51 pound per room per night. The staff is very friendly, very nice. You can buy tours and excursions directly from the consierge & you can also book shuttle service from the hotel to Stansted airport for only 12.5 pounds per person. I would definetely stayed again in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel through Virgin Atlantic Vacations package. The hotel is situated in the Bayswater area on a relative quiet residentilal street. We are familiar with this area as we stayed there many times. Here, the acceptability ends. The hotel has not been well maintained at all The owners have carried the idea of "no-fill" and its "budget" rating to the extreme. On entry, the guests are greeted with a well worn-out welcoming mat which is an eyesore, and then though an always opened paint-peeled door in hideious blue. On entry, the lobby has only a few uncomfortable wooden chairs along the wall for those who need to wait for the rooms to be readied, or to picked up by shuttle services. There is on another wall a well worn and didlipated and filthy couch which even the Salvation Army would likely refuse, While the staff are helpful and courtious, but their competence are wanting. Then along the counter there are a few drooping potted plants which would be much better off being discarded.The rooms are small and barely adequate, but the carpeting are worn and filthy. Gurests are well advised to bring their own soap, as the hotel only provides one or two packets of bath gel and shampoo, no facial tissues It's down-right dangerous to ge in or out of the bath tub which is set on different levels to the bathroom floor. The shower head is set so high, it take some stretching and reaching to bring it sown. As to the Continenal Breakfast, it consists of the basic .(white and wheat sliced bread,with butter and jam, rolls, two kinds of cold cereals, and apple and orange juices. canned fruits, coffee and tea. After six days there, it becames rather monotonous. Also, there's only one chair in the room .If the chair is occupied by wife who needs to make up to get out, the spouse would have to sit on the bed.. As our plane was delayed one night due to mechanical problem and the airline called ahead from Orlando to request the cancellation of the first night and extend anther night at the end, the hotel doesn't want to recognize this and was on the phone aurguing, which is annoying. We don't know what the rate is as it is included in the Virgin Atlantic package. But we definitely will not check in at this hotel again. Travelers are well advised to seek elswhere. It's okay for the very young with tight budgets or travelers from less developed countries. But for others who are looking for a pleasant and relaxing vacation, stay clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stop moaning,how much did you pay!!”
Reviews.Author: quidditch39
Reviews.Content: Went to the queens park hotel for 2 days ,myself and my husband. After reading the reviews i was dreading going to this hotel and almost went somewhere else,but for the price we paid we decided to give it a go,thinking if it was that bad we would just go somewhere else. The first room we were shown 101,was awfull.it was tiny,with no natural light ,there was a window but this just look`d onto a fire escape,which made the room feel even darker,obviously a smoker had used the room before we got there because the room was very heavy with the smell of smoke.The bathroom was so small if you sat on the toilet you would have touched the shower cubical with your knees,no bath. my husband went down to reception and was given ,without question another set of keys. Room 112 was much better,although still small,it was very bright ,looking onto the main steet,there was much more space in this room even with a double bed,wardrobe,and dressing table,The bathroom was also much better having the benifit of the bath and shower.the general decor was abit dated but the room was clean. The continental style breakfast was very good,and there was plently to go round,The only improvement that could be made hear is possably the option of some cold meats or boiled eggs to go with all the other stuff on offer. The staff were good and im sure would be as helpfull as possible if needed. The best part of this hotel by far has to be its location,hyde park on your door step,a 5min walk to marble arch,queensway tube station 2 mins by foot,and a short bus ride to oxford street and central london (if fit you could even walk it ). On a whole i found this hotel to be ok.Yes it could do with some new carpets,Yes it could do with decorating in alot of areas (painters were doing lobby while we were there so they are trying to improve things) and yes the rooms are debatable on the one your given,as to weather sutable or not,but the rooms are clean and the for the price and location of this hotel i would have to say you get good value for your money.A 3* hotel? maybee not ,more like a bed and breakfast,so if you want 1st class service with wonderfull rooms,and views to match, pay the Â£150 pounds pppn or more for that kind of hotel in central london,if your happy with a basic room to sleep in, great breakfast,and an exellent location,then this hotel will probably do you fine.after all its cheap as chips!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the free breakfast (buffet style, continental)”
Reviews.Author: toronto_416_canada
Reviews.Content: We are two asian male travelers in early 20s (ie university students). from Toronto and Montreal and stayed from May 7-10, 2007. The price was really good and the location was close to Queensway station. Liked 1) FREE Breakfast - unlimited amount of cereral with 2% partly skinned milk, croissants, toast, coffee, orange juice, jam, peaches - very good 2) Location - close to Queensway and internet cafes close by 3) Staff - very helpful and pleasant Disliked 1) SMALL Lift - very small elevator for like 1-2 person - do not recommend to bring overly huge suitcases and will not fit - pack LIGHT

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: SpineyNorman
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, at short notice, through Expedia based on the cost and their description. It was truly horrible. The description made the place seem good and mentioned cable TV, free newspapers, bar/lounge and much more - well it has none of these. The room I had was tatty and disgusting. The main fabric of the hotel could not have been redecorated or refurnished for decades - dirty carpets, peeling stained paintwork etc. I can see that if you paid perhaps Â£20, it might be just about worth it but at Â£100 definitely not. The DIY breakfast was the only part that was just about OK.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and reasonably cheerful”
Reviews.Author: FrMartyn
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills, budget hotel for people who are looking for value rather than comfort. Apart from the breakfast room, which shows signs of redecoration, the public areas and the room in which I stayed were tired and uncared-for. Everything worked: shower, kettle, windows but the bed linen and pillows were thin. The staff were efficient and friendly and the hotel seemed well-enough run and reasonably clean. I would certainly stay there again for a night or two, especially on the Â£30 b&b tariff I booked. I don't think that can be beaten for central London.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: gg1956
Reviews.Content: We came to stay at the Queen's Park after being transferred from the hotel down the street where we were originally booked (we arrived in London to find out that the other place was overbooked!). It was definitely a blessing! The Queen's Park Hotel was cleaner and more modern than the other place and the staff much more pleasant (if you want to know where the other place was that we were originally booked into - and stayed for one night - please feel free to email me). The good: Clean rooms with small but servicable bathrooms. Location was great - in an interesting part of London (Bayswater) with lots of action going on two blocks over, but the street the hotel is on is very quiet and charming. The tube is close by (although one of them was out of order and we had to walk a short distance longer for the other one - if you are there on a weekend or holiday, you may run into times when the tube is down for repairs). The not-so- good: Beds not particularly comfortable - a bit hard and lumpy The "continental breakfast" was a joke - cheap slices of bread, Costco-type croissants, corn flakes and rice krispies, coffee and tea and a watery oj (I think - maybe it was grapefruit - hard to tell). This may be an English thing - we ate the breakfasts because it was included and London is so terribly expensive that we figured it was better to fill up on something! Plus they tended to run out out flatware and cups and did not replace it. The lifts (elevators) are teensy - and slow - I tried to walk up and down stairs as much as possible. No wi-fi, but there is one computer in the lobby that you can rent for 1 pound fifty for a half hour. Suggestions, especially for Americans who have not visited London before: Be prepared for the expense! I had heard "it's expensive there" but I've visited NYC, Anchorage and San Francisco multiple times and I thought I understood what "expensive" meant - but I was wrong. Because of the weak dollar, it is even more so, but be prepared in many cases to pay up to 4 times what you are used to in the U.S. (eg, a soda or bottled water in a restaurant can cost $7 or $8!). The one thing that is reasonably priced compared to NYC are the West End shows - defiinitely plan to see one or more - they are Broadway quality and you'll have a great time. Buy a tube and bus combo pass - you can buy these daily unless you are staying for more than 5 days. It gives you unlimited access and the transportation system is really great. To get to the airport, there is a train called Heathrow Express which is about 15 pounds each. But there is a slower train (but not that slow), that is only 7 pounds that also leaves from Paddington Station. We found out about it by accident - our hotel didn't even seem to know about it - and this saved us quite a bit as compared to taking a taxi (we were travelling with our two daughters so multiply everything by 4!). Contact me at feltingmom@gmail.com if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “A bargain, very pleasantly suprised indeed, thanks!!”
Reviews.Author: AJPP
Reviews.Content: We had been originally booked at the Bayswater but were moved on check in to the Queens park- and after paying just ?39 inc breakfast for a double room in Central London and reading reviews of the Bayswater beforehand, my wife and I were a 'lot' apprehensive!!I have to say in all honesty, firstly in terms of service, we were more than happy the entire stay, from the moment the friendly lady greeted us at the Bayswater and sorted our pre paid taxi transfer,, to checking in at the Queens Park, welcomed by genuinely corteous desk staff, getting an upgraded room without asking, to chatting about local info and football etc- no attitudes just good service...All rooms worked on key cards so there no door keys to lose/hand back either which was a relief.Yes the room was very small, no it wasnt brand new or pristinely perfect and yes the hotel in general is well used and a little tired in places it was nether the less a bargain- it was clean enough, had wardrobes, mirrors, en suite, tea/coffee, big tv and a clean bed- and for us and most other London explorers, a hotel room is merely to wash, store clothes and sleep in, and in ours we were able to do just that-The bathroom smelt clean and fresh and was tidy/good order-There was also no noise whatsoever throughout our stay so no interupted sleep.and as for location, it was spot on- Queensway tube stop is barely 2 mins down the main road, 30 seconds if you jog, there are loads of buses at the end of the road, and the hotel is also minutes away from the park, nice bars/pubs, branded high st shops, fast food, convinience stores, restaurants etc...Queensway stop is also barely a few stops from Oxford Street so location was genuinely perfect for us.After reading about the Bayswaters breakfast offer and previous reviews, we had already made our minds up we would avoid breakfast, however, until that was we went and looked, what a top suprise, Cereals, toast, croissants, juices, coffee, tea, fresh fruit...brilliant!! (we ate lots and saved even more money, it was also well presented, fresh and delicious too)All in all, for what we wanted in a hotel as abase, and what we paid it was an absolute bargain, yes you can pay double that and get a modern, spotlessly clean, pristine branded chain hotel, but unless you intend to spend your stay sat in your room, watching tv, why bother? In life, yes you get what you pay for, but I genuinely feel, for the location, service and price, we got a lot more than we paid or bargained for here and my apprehensive expectations were more than suppassed.My advice, if you want a swanky roomy big name branded chain hotel to lounge away the evenings and days in and moneys not a question, look elsewhere, if you want a smaller, friendly base to explore London at a bargain price you can do a lot worse than give the Queens Park a try.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise surprise....actually quite good!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pellican
Reviews.Content: Okay, this review may shock a few peple who have seen the pictures of this place or stayed there.... Originally, we booked to stay at the Bayswater Inn but, as these things always go, when we arrived there we were told it was fully booked and we were going to be shifted to a partner hotel...the Queens Park Hotel. Obviously this was followed by some disappointment and we weren't particularly impressed by the room we were given...it was tiny, the TV looked like it may fall off the stand any time soon and there was no view at all, unless you like external staircases. The bathroom wasn't great either, the shower was dirty and you couldn't sit on the toilet without banging against the sink. Pretty dire really. We went back to reception and told them, in a nice way of course, that we wanted to leave the hotel entirely. We were offered another room at this point. The guy at the desk explained that this was a brand new part of the hotel and so we agreed to look at it...they actually showed us TWO rooms. These rooms were located in the basement and there was still work going on around the stair area. However, the rooms were GREAT! [Okay, not totally 5* or anything but for the price we paid - about Â£55 per night, you would be hard pressed to find something that good in a central area]. I have uploaded the pictures and I am sure you will be able to tell them apart from the others. Everything was brand new and there was even an LCD TV. The only disadvantages were that it was in the basement so not a great view, but hey, we were there to sight-see so it really didn't matter. We did originally ask for a double bed but af you can see in the pictures we had two singles set together. The other nice room we were shown did have a double bed but we just preferred this room. Also, the walls are not very sound proof, but we didn't really bother about this. We were just extremely lucky with the room! Breakfast was included and it's stuff like cereal, toast, tea, juice...not highly amazing but enough to get you started for the day. Arrive on time as at precisely 10am [weekdays] they will whip everything away. The area is really nice, especially if you want a multi-cultural outlook. It didn't feel like London at all! Hyde park is just a minute away and Queensway tube is about 3 min walk, i.e. round the corner and very conveniently on the central line. Personally, we won't book with this hotel again, but that is not because we didn't like it. There is no guarantee we would get a great room again. If you do want to go for it, I would suggest you ask for the basement rooms if you can. It's a bargain is you get it for Â£50 - 60 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another cancellation”
Reviews.Author: SYSTIX
Reviews.Content: I can't comment on the rooms or anything at this hotel since having booked it online we were told on arrival that our room had been flooded and they couldn't accomodate us. They booked us into a hotel nearby (which incidentally was pretty aweful). Some friends also booked this hotel and the same thing happened - except a faulty boiler was blamed this time. Strange how often this seems to happen when you read the reviews on trip advisor don't you think? Nuff said!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear !!!”
Reviews.Author: Christmasangel
Reviews.Content: Too many things to describe, just dont waste your money on this shabby hovel. My daughter & I came away covered in bites.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nola70125
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located near a Tube stop, Kensington gardens, several restaurants, an Internet cafe and a change bureau. The staff was pleasant as well. However, our room and common areas needed new paint and carpeting, and the bathroom tile was mismatched and old; finally, there was a rat trap near the night stand. The hotel was not the cleanest, and the walls were very thin - we could hear everything in the next room. This hotel was tolerable because we stayed only 2 nights. The nightly rate was economical, but I would have rather paid a bit more for a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “enjoed the stay”
Reviews.Author: NIELSON
Reviews.Content: Recenty stayed in this hotel as part of a weekend break with my husband. The moment we checked in, wee were welcomed by friendly staff, courteuos concierge who took our luggage right up to the room and showed us the room. When entering the room we were satisfied with the condition, the room seemed recently refubished. The ameneties all there as advertised. The staff were extremely responsive and the housekeeping department were always good. We paid a fair price for what we had received and included breakfast which was very good. Consisted of a full continental breakfast which had a good variety. The hotel was in good condition, the staff were extremely friendly and the location was fantastic, really is in the centre of London with Hyde Park only accross the road and underground stations nearby. Buses also pass through this area. All in all, my husband and I really enjoyed our stay. The only downide was the the lifts were small, but they were in good working order.

Reviews.Title: “London trip”
Reviews.Author: airportblues
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say this was the best hotel I have stayed at but that would not be true. I booked two doubles for two nights and a single for one night, on arrival we had to spend first night in basement room for 4 as the two doubles were not available, the basement room was supposed to be a superior room but in fact was anything but. Second night had two double rooms one of which was very small, upon entering this room I thought it was a single as the bed was so small. Some of the furniture in the rooms we used was falling apart and some of the beds were very lumpy. On arrival at the hotel one lift was out of action the other was exceedingly small. The continental breakfast was not the best meal I have ever had. On the plus side the location was fine for our purposes, not to far from queens park underground station. The area was pleasant and close to Hyde Park. At the price we paid for the rooms, Â£55 for a double per night, you could say we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel.........”
Reviews.Author: Robert26
Reviews.Content: I think the website of this hotel should be updated with proper picture of the lobby, reception and rooms etc. It looks nothing like the website - totally misleading to bookers. The hotel is dreadful and would never stay there again. It should be described as a hostel not a hotel..... our family booked in before us and was given a room which can only be described as a prison cell - it had a small window at the top, broken furniture and toilet. There was a terrible smell on the stairs leading up to the rooms and on investigating what the smell was, we found dogs muck on the stairs. I would never recommend this hotel and will never stay there again - if it is the last hotel in London available - would rather sleep on a park bench! The Hotel should be closed down, refurbished and then re-open. I wish I had taken pictures and then made up my own website on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “False and misleading advertising”
Reviews.Author: OzzieStu
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August 2006 and from the outset the advertising and photographs of the hotel are false and misleading. This is just slightly above a basic backpackers lodge. It has no bar as advertised, the restaurant if you can call it that does not look anything like the photos and there is no lounge. The only place to sit is next to the Concierge on a battered and broken three seater. The staff were reasonably friendly, the rooms totally over rated. They were tiny and cramped, our double bed was pushed against a wall that meant my wife had to climb over me to get in and out of bed. No aircondition so we had to have the window open, the noise was unbelievable. There is a set of flats/apartments opposite where the young tenants sit on the doorway yelling and talking all night. We cut our stay short and went to a Travelodge - much better and a lot cheaper. The only thing in QP's favour was the location, just metres from Hyde Park and Queensgate.

Reviews.Title: “Locked out of our own room, twice!”
Reviews.Author: Trcjmatt
Reviews.Content: Pictures of the lobby, outside, and "restaurant" are very misleading. This is definitely a low budget hotel. The restaurant is really only open for breakfast. The staff is no way overly friendly, although we did have a very meticulous maid. Our key card failed to let us into our room twice, the second time beacuse we were trying to get into our room 5 minutes after check-out time. As we were on the 5th floor and the elevator trip probably takes a minute a floor, this was extremely annoying. The shower setup was very strange- there was a ledge between the tub and the wall the shower head was on. There was no remote for the TV and the Channel Up button on the TV, which turns it on, was missing. The matress was absolutely disgusting. It looked very yellow and old and was very hard. There was an extra blanket undeneath the sheet being used as a matress pad. The location is very nice, though- most convenient to the Queensway Tube station (just redone) and Kensington Park. The area seemed very safe, even late at night, and we didn't have any trouble sleeping through any street noise with our window open all night. I would not stay here again unless I was on a very, very tight budget and needed to be in this area of London.

Reviews.Title: “The Queens Park Hotel is just like Blackpool Lancashire”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the hotel sharing a twin room with my son, to be honest my son was paying, so the price was important. The hotel reminded me of one from Blackpool, with upgrades going on all the time. Our room was on the 4th floor, I went up in the lift once only, which only fits two people, the other lift was broken, and as I have seen from past reviews has been for a while. The stairs are very narrow and the upper floors feel clostrophobic as you climb, the floors are on a downward slope, even the mattress on our beds. But the rooms where very clean and comfortable and for the price I was very happy. If I was a family with small children I would ask for a room on the first floor. We did not find the bar on arriving back at 10pm which was disappointing, but managed to get a bottle of water from reception. The restaurant was not open on the Thursday evening we arrived, and next day at breakfast it was, make your own toast, no cloths on tables and not very helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes it's better to splurge...especially if you want to sleep well.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire for a very low price. The location is fantastic and is within walking distance to Kensington Gardens, Hyde Park and, if you're up for a bit of exercise, Notting Hill. There's also a lot of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. However, as most of the other reviews state, the hotel leaves a lot to be desired. The elevator is ridiculously small- there's barely enough room for one traveler and a suitcase. You literally can't turn around in it and it's very slow. The room was also very, very small. I requested a two person room so I was given a very small double bed. There was just enough room for two people to lay side by side without much movement. The bed was like sleeping on sawdust as were the pillows. The restaurant is non existent except for breakfast- apparently you have to make an advance booking and even then, it has to be for a party of ten or more which seems a little pointless. The 'business center' is a computer and a chair in the lobby with access to a fax machine and copier if you ask. As the other review stated, the bathroom was miniscule. The sink is over the toilet and banging of the knees was a bit of a problem. The service was polite and efficient but not particularly friendly or helpful. Since our stay was for one night only, the Queen's Park was tolerable however, for longer stays, I would definitely not recommend it. Even if you plan to be in your room only to sleep, you won't really get a decent rest in these rooms- the beds are frightful and the neighbourhood isn't the quietest. While the price may seem low, sometimes it's better to pay a little more to get a decent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Someone broke in our room while we were sleeping!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Someone broke in our room while we were sleeping!! We were robbed. They snatched a purse and brief case. I found the brief case in the stair well. The staff was not helpful. It was only at the request of the police that we were able to change rooms. None of the doors have latches. Two good things: Hot water readily available and a good locatiopn to the tube, bus and Hyde Park

Reviews.Title: “Pretty shabby place- but fine for a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are used to north american hotel standards, this is probably not the hotel for you. The decor is pretty trashy and the linens look and feel like they were purchased in the 1970's. There is peeling wallpaper and stained furniture in both the lobby and the hotel rooms themselves. Not the best place I've stayed but not totally repulsive either. Basically, you pay for what you get and in this case given the cheap price, it's no wonder that it didn't feel like I was staying in a four-star hotel. They rate themselves as being a three-star hotel but do not be fooled by this - it is really more like a glorified one-star hotel to be honest. Stay here if you need to save a buck! Elevator was out of order when we arrived, but location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “A greatful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was great. I went with my couple on holidays and we were very happpy. The staff of the hotel were very helpful with us, but one thing was that they didn't make the effort of speaking to me slowler unless they notice to be foreigner. But this is not a problem at all. The room was clean, small but clean. Only one problem the last day, the cleaner cleaned the spoons on the bathroom and put them again inside the cups, like news!! well, it's not good for this kind of hotel... The location of the hotel was perfect, near notting hill, near the tube, a lot of shops near, resaturants... The only seriously problem that I had was that they asked me for a credit card number because it was something broken when I leave. And they return me the money 3 weeks after I came back to Spain and because I went to the travel agency to say that they didn't return me the money. If not, they woudn't return me the money!! The breakfast was not good at all, but it's English breakfast! The coffee was water not coffee!! But, I recomended you to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “service let's it down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Queens Park hotel london, having read reviews prior to our trip, we were pleasantly surprised that our room although small was clean and well laid out. The hotel service was however non existent. The lifts were working prior to check in then mysteriously hand written notes appeared stating both were out of order. The stairs are very steep, I was grateful our room was ONLY on the 3rd and not the 5th floor. There appeared to be no visable sign of these being repaired. The complimentary newspaper was unavailable on request as was room service despite being advertised. The breakfast in the foyer looked ok however when we arrived 20 minutes prior to deadline there was an absence of hot drinks and the staff had disappeared. The location of the hotel is superb and to be fair we were hardly in our room at all, it was an annoyance that the service was so poor. I would recommend the bayswater area for excellent bars and restaurants, do check out the indoor shopping centre, great cinema and restaurants on the upper floors. It is a vibrant area and not expensive. As for Queenspark if you are relatively fit and indifferent to the staff give it a go,at a discounted rate only.

Reviews.Title: “Saved a fortune!”
Reviews.Author: boffpa
Reviews.Content: Read all the other moaners- what do you expect for this kind of money? What does the room size matter whilst you sleep? Have a couple of drinks afore bedtime and all will be fine. Yes the lift is tiny and slow, have a laugh - do the same about the bathroom. If you are over picky about sheets and carpets - then pay 10 times more somewhere else and be happy with that. It's a cracking location for access to this part of London, the breakfast is OK, just book one night. Perhaps get a bottle of Champagne with the money you have saved and enjoy the day!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of reading the generally dreadful reviews on this hotel after booking and paying for a room. I wasn't therefore expecting anything except an argument with the hotel about the dozen unacceptable problems that I anticipated. However, for the GBP 37.50 I paid (for a hotel in an excellent London location) for a double room including breakfast, there was precious little to complain about. The room (501) was warm, clean, freshly decorated, reasonably furnished and quite spacious. Ok, the carpets in the public areas were a little threadbare and the lift (one working out of two) was fine only for anorexic midgets but, on the basis of my experience this hotel represents good value for money. Really, you can do very much worse than this for the same money or more.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was so small you could sit on the toilet, brush your teeth, and wash your feet in the tub at the same time. Come to think of it, you could actually sit there and take a shower at the same time since there was no shower curtain and the entire room got a soaking. There was no where to open a suitcase unless you wanted to walk on it to get into the bed. Bed...so hard and lumpy we couldn't even relax. And the loud partying from a downstairs nightclub made sleep impossible. Yikes, I could go on, about the elevator that could only hold one suitcase, without a passenger.

Reviews.Title: “Pick Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at this hotel and I'd have to say, its the worst hotel I've ever been in. 1st off, the rooms are small. When I say small, I mean 100 sq.ft. if you are lucky. Then throw in a bed (might as well be a block of wood), the dresser, your luggage, and soon after you check in, you'll be looking for a new hotel. Just trust myself and many others, do not waste your money or time or ruin a good vacation with a crappy room from this hotel. Ohh yeah, did I mention the elevator that is only big enough for 1 person (2 if your super skinny) at one time? But if you do decide to not heed this warning, just print out my review and take it with you. Put it in the section of your travel-book titled (London Hotels). I want to make sure you read my review when you go looking for a new hotel. Not to make the review all negative, I will say at least the hotel is only a short walk from a Tube Stop.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Room very small and dirty. Bathroom likewise, had to close door to be able to turn roound. Bed and bedding very poor, matress very old with protruding springs . "Continental Breakfast was appallling. We were met by surly staff, cornflakes or crispies, rolls or cold croissants and tinned fruit. No cheese meat eggs or toast. Luckily we were only staying one night, as an Englishman I felt like apologising to the overseas guests. Rack rate Â£150 per night, how can they justify this. I was lucky, I booked through laterooms so "only" paid Â£50.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel,this is great value. The single rooms are small but that's OK. All clean and compact. Breakfast was super in comparison to some other budget hotels that I have stayed in. When I return to London I will definitely stay here again. J.WADELTON, MELBOURNE, AUSTRALIA

HotelInfo.Name: Queens Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 48 Queensborough Terrace | Bayswater, London W2 3SJ, England
